Title: Create sensor_images_example py
Body: Some simple python functions demonstrating how to parse and visualise sensor data.

Title: Fixed map made it fancier now agents move around and plotting is fast
small bug on brake value type on example
Travis ci support
Body: Adding pylint continuous integration for the "carla" Python API and the examples.

Title: Adding 360 Lidars support similar to Velodyne HDL 32E or VLP 16
Body: You may add any number of lidars to the car. Lidars have following settings with specified default values:    \# Number of lasers  Channels = 32    \# Measure distance  Range = 5000    \# Points generated by all lasers per second  PointsPerSecond = 100000    \# Lidar rotation frequency  RotationFrequency = 10    \# Upper laser angle  counts from horizontal   \# positive values means above horizontal line  UpperFovLimit = 10    \# Lower laser angle  counts from horizontal   \# negative values means under horizontal line  LowerFovLimit = -30    \# wether to show debug points of laser hits in simulator  ShowDebugPoints = False    \# Position relative to the player.  LidarPositionX = 0  LidarPositionY = 0  LidarPositionZ = 250    \# Rotation relative to the player.  LidarRotationPitch = 0  LidarRotationRoll = 0  LidarRotationYaw = 0    Default values choosed close to Velodyne HDL-32E.  Also one lidar added to ./manual_control.py. You may see bird eye view of lidar points in upper left corner.    Lidar was made using UWorld::LineTraceSingleByChannel method. Serialization of lidar measurement made similarly to camera images.

Title: Stricter continuous integration tests
Body: Now Python code will need to pass [Pylint](https://www.pylint.org/) clean of **errors and warnings** in Python 2.7  3.5 and 3.6.    I also added a [Cppcheck](http://cppcheck.sourceforge.net/) static analyser test for the C++ code that may catch some issues.

Title: Add option to skip content download
Body: Added the `-s` and `--skip-download` options to "Update.sh" and "Setup.sh". This way people having troubles downloading the 10GB of content can manually download this file  possibly from somewhere else  and run setup.

Title: Benchmark branch
Body: Adding the benchmark branch.    Use the run_benchmark system to benchmark an agent.    Resolve #51 too.

Title: PEP8 configuration
Body: Increases PEP8 line length to 120.    80 is good as general rule but sometimes too short as to be always corrected.    The `.pep8` file is recognised by tools like autopep8

Title: Point cloud from depth
Body: Fix #86.    Example client that converts a depth image into a point cloud using the intrinsic and extrinsic matrices.  The 3D point cloud is written in [PLY](http://paulbourke.net/dataformats/ply/) format.    ![77ed4f72ee203b2ee061c1e98086d423](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15848712/34207392-8bdb8410-e58a-11e7-8c3c-06f958261721.png)

Title: Fix road map generator generates duplicated meshes
Body: #### Description    While iterating the graph I was adding road both for a half-edge and its pair. Now I keep a count of the edges (and its pairs) that have being visited and skip the visited ones.    Fix #221.    #### Where has this been tested?      * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04    * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.17.2

Title: Redesign sensor related code
Body: <!--      - [ ] Your branch is up-to-date with the `master` branch and tested with latest changes    - [ ] Extended the README / documentation  if necessary    - [ ] Code compiles correctly    - [ ] All tests passing      - [ ] `make check`      - [ ] `pylint --disable=R C --rcfile=PythonClient/.pylintrc PythonClient/carla PythonClient/*.py`      - [ ] `cppcheck . -iBuild -i.pb.cc --enable=warning`    -->    #### Description      * Fix #200 Define a common interface for easily adding sensors    * Fix #238 Allow sensor data to be captured asynchronously    > **Note:** Data is not yet captured asynchronously  but the new design allows to easily do it.    #### Important changes      * _"CarlaSettings.ini"_ syntax changed.    * Encoding of sensor data through network protocol changed.    * Small changes to Python API.    #### Where has this been tested?      - [x] Ubuntu 16.04    - [x] Windows    - [x] Python 2.7    - [x] Python 3.5    - [x] Unreal Engine 4.17    - [x] Unreal Engine 4.18    #### New CarlaSettings syntax    Mostly just generalizes the concept of cameras to sensors.    ```ini  [CARLA/Sensor]  Sensors=MyCamera MyCamera/Depth MyLidar    [CARLA/Sensor/MyCamera]  SensorType=CAMERA  PostProcessing=SceneFinal  ImageSizeX=800  ImageSizeY=600  FOV=90  PositionX=15  PositionY=0  PositionZ=123  RotationPitch=8  RotationRoll=0  RotationYaw=0    [CARLA/Sensor/MyCamera/Depth]  PostProcessing=Depth    [CARLA/Sensor/MyLidar]  SensorType=LIDAR_RAY_TRACE  Channels=32  Range=5000  PointsPerSecond=100000  RotationFrequency=10  UpperFOVLimit=10  LowerFOVLimit=-30  PositionX=0  PositionY=0  PositionZ=140  RotationPitch=0  RotationYaw=0  RotationRoll=0  ```    #### Python API for Lidar    ```py  measurements  sensor_data = client.read_data()    for sensor_name  sensor_data in sensor_data.items():      if isinstance(sensor_data  sensor.LidarMeasurement):                for point in sensor_data.data:            print(point)          sensor_data.save_to_disk('point_cloud.ply')          sensor_data.horizontal_angle        sensor_data.channels_count        sensor_data.points_count_by_channel        sensor_data.point_cloud  ```

Title: Added an example code with more functionaly than present examples
Body: This is to some extent a combination fo the client_example.py and  the manual_control.py. The code is commented much better and the  readability is tried to be improved.    <!--    Thanks for sending a pull request! Please make sure you click the link above to  view the contribution guidelines  then fill out the blanks below.    Checklist:      - [x] Your branch is up-to-date with the `master` branch and tested with latest changes    - [x] Extended the README / documentation  if necessary    - [ x] Code compiles correctly    - [x] All tests passing      - [ ] `make check`      - [ ] `pylint --disable=R C --rcfile=PythonClient/.pylintrc PythonClient/carla PythonClient/*.py`      - [ ] `cppcheck . -iBuild -i.pb.cc --enable=warning`    -->    #### Description    <!-- Please explain the changes you made here as detailed as possible. -->    Fixes #  <!-- If fixes an issue  please add here the issue number. -->    Added a Python client example code which has much more functionality than the existent example codes. It is in a way a combination of both the example codes.  This will provide the users to easily save the images to the disk in a user readable format  has autopilot and manual mode and other features.   Also  an attempt was done to make code as easy to customize as possible. User can just change the make settings part of the code to work with his/her requirement and the code works.     #### Where has this been tested?      * **Platform(s):** Linux    * **Python version(s):** Python2.7 and Python3.5    * **Unreal Engine version(s):** UE 4.17    #### Possible Drawbacks    None. The more examples  the merrier    <!-- What are the possible side-effects or negative impacts of the code change? -->

Title: Adding 360 Lidars support
Body: Adding the changes of #69.    Resolve #68.    - - -  ![peek 2018-01-19 17-28](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4332953/35161946-081b55cc-fd42-11e7-9527-87b17b9da03a.gif)    You may add any number of lidars to the car. Lidars have following settings with specified default values:    ```  # Number of lasers  Channels = 32    # Measure distance  Range = 5000    # Points generated by all lasers per second  PointsPerSecond = 100000    # Lidar rotation frequency  RotationFrequency = 10    # Upper laser angle  counts from horizontal   # positive values means above horizontal line  UpperFovLimit = 10    # Lower laser angle  counts from horizontal   # negative values means under horizontal line  LowerFovLimit = -30    # wether to show debug points of laser hits in simulator  ShowDebugPoints = False    # Position relative to the player.  LidarPositionX = 0  LidarPositionY = 0  LidarPositionZ = 250    # Rotation relative to the player.  LidarRotationPitch = 0  LidarRotationRoll = 0  LidarRotationYaw = 0  ```    Default values choosed close to Velodyne HDL-32E.  Also one lidar added to `manual_control.py`. You may see bird eye view of lidar points in upper left corner.    Lidar was made using UWorld::LineTraceSingleByChannel method. Serialization of lidar measurement made similarly to camera images.

Title: Adjust agent bounding boxes
Body: #### Description    Adjusts the Z coordinates of the vehicles' box extent  it also shifts the vehicle position on the Z axis to match the center of the bounding box. The pivot point of the vehicle has also been changed to align with the center of the mesh.      * Fixes #83 Adjust height of vehicles' bounding boxes    * Fixes #265 Fix Vehicle meshes center.    #### Possible Drawbacks    The position of the vehicle has been slightly shifted up in the Z axis.

Title: Add box extent to player measurements
Body: #### Description    The player is removed from the list of non-player agents and its bounding box is sent with the player measurements.    Fixes #268.    #### Possible Drawbacks    The player is not in the list of non-player agents which can break external client code relying on this.

Title: Convert measurements to SI units
Body: #### Description    All the units have been converted to SI units    ```                   before         now  ---------------------------------------  locations        cm         --> m  speed            km/h       --> m/s  acceleration     (km/h)/s   --> m/s^2  collisions       kg*cm/s    --> kg*m/s  angles           degrees    --> degrees  ```    Fixes #132.    #### Possible Drawbacks    This is actually a tricky change  all the client code dependent on units should be carefully checked.

Title: Add autopilot mode to manual control example
Body: #### Description    Added an option to toggle autopilot mode in the `manual_control.py` Python example.    It can be enabled when launching the script with the `-a` or `--autopilot` switches (as the other examples)        $ ./manual_control.py -a    Once in game can be toggled pressing `P`  just like in the server window in no-networking mode.    Fixes #282.    #### Where has this been tested?      * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04    * **Python version(s):** 2.7 and 3.5

Title: Optimizations
Body: #### Description    Introduce a set of changes that will add optimizations into the CARLA Unreal Engine project. Initially includes Low and Epic quality settings levels.    Changes applied in this branch:      - Generates pieces for the road    - Add CARLA settings page in the Unreal Project Settings screen:    - Draw distance for low quality levels for light  road pieces and other primitive components    ###### Fixes    - Fixes #253 Add quality level settings  - Fixes #252 Use actors instead of instances in road generator  - Fixes #251 Screen captures are now being performed inside the render queue  - Closes #99 Creating Carla Map Generator causes crash (no longer an issue)    #### Where has this been tested?      * **Windows 10** ...    * **Linux (Ubuntu 16.4):** ...    * **Unreal Engine 4.18** ...    #### Possible Drawbacks    Check your road generation in the CarlaMapGenerator you may have in your levels to regenerate (using the new method).   Check your draw distance for meshes and roads.  Check that you are including the new CARLA/QualitySettings -> DefaultLevel in your CarlaSettings.ini. (levels are None  Low or Epic right now)

Title: Optimizations
Body: Some fixes included in this pull request.      - [x] Walkers uses a closer angle to detect vehicles and the algorithm is changed (will be moved again to async find path)    - [x] Changes in code formatting     #### Description    Most of the changes are related to settings  pedestrian AIs and vehicle spawning    Fixed #246  Fixed #318  Fixed #330   Fixed #334      - [x] Minor bugs fixed      - [x] Vehicles spawner spawns correctly the number specified in the configuration (carla settings file) using a timer to spawn more if there is no space at the start      - [x] Changes in the screen captures using HDR instead of LDR for SceneFinal in Low Quality mode      - [x] Minor changes in Carla Settings      #### Where has this been tested?      * **Platform(s):** GNU/Linux [Ubuntu 16.04] and Windows10     * **Python version(s):** 3.6.4    * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.18.3    #### Possible Drawbacks    Changes in the walkers behaviors due to the percepcion ray angle

Title: Add frame number to measurements and sensor data
Body: #### Description    Adds a _frame number_ field to the measurements message and the sensor data packages. This way it is possible to match sensor data received asynchronously with their corresponding measurements.    ```py  measurements  sensor_data = client.read_data()    measurements.frame_number    for name  data in sensor_data.items():      data.frame_number  ```    The `frame_number` comes from Unreal's `GFrameCounter` and it is not restarted on each episode.     Fixes #332.    #### Where has this been tested?      * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04    * **Python version(s):** 3.5 and 2.7    * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.18    #### Drawbacks    The codification of the sensor data changes thus is not compatible with previous versions.

Title: Rollback vehicle s location and send relative transform of bounding box
Body: #### Description    Vehicle's position goes back to be at the bottom of the model (pivot)  since now the bounding box is not centered with this position we need to send its transform too.    ```proto  message BoundingBox {    // Transform relative to the vehicle.    Transform transform = 1;    Vector3D extent = 2;  }    message Vehicle {    Transform transform = 1;    BoundingBox bounding_box = 4;    float forward_speed = 3;  }  ```    Fixes #345.    #### Where has this been tested?      * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04    * **Python version(s):** 3.5 and 2.7    * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.18    #### Possible Drawbacks    Box extent is not longer present in the agent message  now it is inside the `bounding_box`.

Title: Windows setup and rebuild automatization
Body: #### Description "Setup.bat" and "Rebuild.cmd" automation for Windows platform. `Setup.bat`: It downloads and installs Protobuf and Boost. `Rebuild.bat`: Builds the project. #### How to test? 1. Open the `Visual Studio x64 Native Tools Command Prompt` and navigate to the carla folder. 1. Run Setup.cmd -j 8 --boost-toolset msvc-14.1 (Optional) Setup.cmd --help (You can see the available commands for instance which `--boost-toolset` you have to use depending on the Visual Studio version that you have installed) 1. When it's done download the Assets with the link provided when `Setup.cmd` finishes. 1. Finally run Rebuild.bat that will compile carlaserver and start the Unreal project. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Win10 x64 * **Python version(s):** -- * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.18.3 #### Possible Drawbacks **[Linx]** CMake modified it could be nice if someone test this branch in Linux. **[Win]** Can make that already created projects fail (due to a new Boost file distribution) --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/429)

Title: Adding unit acceptance test for map changing
Body: Hello @juaxix Thanks for the very useful feature of map changing on client side ! First of all I added on carla/settings.py the possibility of changing the map name on the carla settings code. Quite trivial. Now about the tests. At first it seemed to be working correctly. I was able to start CARLA on Town01 and execute tests on Town02. However I decided to make a test to stress this map change since it is a very important functionality. For that I created the acceptance_test called " test_map_changing.py" Basically what it does is changing maps from Town01 to Town02 and then Town02 to Town01 ... repeating this process 8 times. At each time it asserts if the map name received is the same as the map loaded by the client. What happens is the following: It starts on town 01 receives town01 --- Correct It starts on town 02 receives town02 --- Correct Then something weird happens: It starts on town 01 receives town02 and the connection crashes! Please accept the pull request and try to reproduce the problem by running the test_map_changing.py script with nosetests3. Thanks again. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/472)

Title: Change HUD replace FPS by Simulation Step
Body: The fixed time-step mode keeps generating a lot of confusion. I think partly because of using the term FPS for both modes while they're not exactly the same (frames-per-simulation-second vs frames-per-real-second). While we cannot change the command line args because they're handled by UE4 at least we can change the HUD. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/478)

Title: Add Dockerfile for running Carla releases
Body: Adding the Dockerfile provided by @germanros1987 to the repo. I changed _Package.sh_ to include the Dockerfile automatically on each new release. Download and extract the [release package](http://158.109.9.218:8080/blue/organizations/jenkins/carla/detail/PR-481/1/artifacts) and on that folder ``` $ docker build -t carla -f Dockerfile . $ docker run -p 2000-2002:2000-2002 --runtime=nvidia -e NVIDIA_VISIBLE_DEVICES=0 carla:latest ./CarlaUE4.sh /Game/Maps/Town01 -benchmark -carla-server -fps=10 -world-port=2000 -windowed -ResX=100 -ResY=100 -carla-no-hud ``` --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/481)

Title: Change autopilot to turn at intersections based on front wheels position
Body: This modifies the autopilot to look at the front wheels position while following way-points. This makes the turns at intersections more coherent among vehicles independently of their length. **Important: This requires the latest changes in the map as the intersections have been slightly adapted to the new behavior. This changes will be made public with the 0.8.4 release.** - - - This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/507)

Title: New build system and architecture for networking communication
Body: #### Description Following #439 here I'm reorganizing the repository to accommodate the new architecture. - [x] Fix #529 Build system for the new architecture - [x] Fix #566 Upgrade to Unreal Engine 4.19 - [x] Fix #555 RPC integration - [x] Fix #495 Streaming sensor data to multiple clients - [x] Fix #530 Implement first version of the new Python API and as bonus - [x] Fix #466 Embed version tag in code Once everything is done this closes #439. #### Where has this been tested? So far the new modules only compile in Linux. * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04 * **Python version(s):** 2.7 and 3.5 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.19 - - - This is what's already supported ```python import random import time import carla c = carla.Client('localhost' 2000) c.set_timeout(1000) # milliseconds assert c.get_client_version() == c.get_server_version() world = c.get_world() library = world.get_blueprint_library(); # Pull a random vehicle from the library. vehicles = library.filter('vehicle'); bp = random.choice(vehicles) if bp.contains_attribute('number_of_wheels'): n = bp.get_attribute('number_of_wheels') print('got vehicle %r with %d wheels' % (bp.id n)) # You can change the color. bp.set_attribute('color' '0 0 255') # Spawn vehicle at transform. transform = carla.Transform( carla.Location(x=0.0 y=0.0 z=5.0) carla.Rotation(yaw=random.uniform(0 360))) vehicle = world.spawn_actor(bp transform) # Most of the objects are printable. print(vehicle) # You can teleport actors to a given location or transform. vehicle.set_location(carla.Location(x=180 y=199 z=38)) # You can enable/disable the old autopilot too. vehicle.set_autopilot(True) # Add a camera to the vehicle. camera_bp = bp_library.find('camera') camera_transform = carla.Transform(carla.Location(x=0.4 y=0.0 z=1.4)) camera = world.spawn_actor(camera_bp camera_transform attach_to=vehicle) # Register a lambda to be called every time we receive an image from the camera. camera.listen(lambda image: do_something_here()) try: while True: # Control the vehicle. control = carla.VehicleControl( throttle=random.uniform(0.3 1.0) steer=random.uniform(-0.1 0.1)) vehicle.apply_control(control) time.sleep(1) finally: # Destroy the actor removes it from the simulation. vehicle.destroy() ``` --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/567)

Title: Adding the initial version of the example RL environment
Body: ### Description Adding the initial version of the example RL environment for CARLA. This is a simple wrapper around the existing python client that lets you make steps in the environment and receive states. Also a simple test with making a video of a random agent is included. The environment assumes the server is already running and takes its hostname and port number as parameters. I placed the env module inside the PythonClient/carla package (feel free to suggest other locations). This is the initial version. I'm waiting for your feedback. Fixes #300 #### Where has this been tested? I tested it by running the server locally on a Ubuntu-16.04 machine and connecting an environment to it. #### Possible Drawbacks Users will want to change the reward function state and possible actions so that it fits their experiments so this is by no means a complete implementation. It's rather a starting point for modifications. Otherwise we could make all these things configurable but covering all the cases will require a lot of effort. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/316)

Title: Non rendering mode
Body: Changes to enable or disable rendering of the world (Unreal render) and CARLA HUDs (Unreal HUD rendering) using a property of the server settings. The changes involve: - [x] Clients can use the DisableRendering flag - [x] Added the option in : Carla.Settings.ini -> [CARLA/Server] -> DisableRendering - [x] Added the argument for runtime : "-disable-rendering" - Tests needed #### Example Using the code for manual_control.py with this modification: ```py def make_carla_settings(args): """Make a CarlaSettings object with the settings we need.""" settings = CarlaSettings() settings.set( SynchronousMode=True SendNonPlayerAgentsInfo=True NumberOfVehicles=15 NumberOfPedestrians=30 WeatherId=random.choice([1 3 7 8 14]) QualityLevel=args.quality_level DisableRendering=True) settings.randomize_seeds() if args.lidar: lidar = sensor.Lidar('Lidar32') lidar.set_position(0 0 2.5) lidar.set_rotation(0 0 0) lidar.set( Channels=32 Range=50 PointsPerSecond=100000 RotationFrequency=10 UpperFovLimit=10 LowerFovLimit=-30) settings.add_sensor(lidar) return settings ``` we are removing all the sensors except for the lidar. We can launch the client with a command like this: > PythonClient$ python manual_control.py -a -l Screenshot of the result : ![example_no_render](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/996806/40905593-b24e5b8c-67de-11e8-9f57-66c14f802692.JPG) #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s): Windows and Linux * **Python version(s): ** 2.6 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.18.3 #### Possible Drawbacks You may want to draw huds? child of #286. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/469)

Title: Wheels speed
Body: #### Description I needed to simulate a wheels' rotational speed sensor for a research project; then I modified all the necessary source files in order to achieve this. The rotational speed is estimated using current and past wheels' position (in angle) the position is taken from PhysX model's function: GetRotationAngle() which gives the position in degrees. It's then converted in radians so that the wheels' rotational speed computed is in rad/s. The four rotational speeds computed (one for each wheel) are accessible from CARLA client they're stored in player measurements. I've made this PR in case it could be of any use to anyone. Fixes # #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Lenovo Thinkpad L470 with Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3.5.5 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.18 #### Possible Drawbacks --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/549)

Title: Fix streaming client fails to connect in Windows
Body: #### Description ~~I have change the way the streaming client connects now it uses a resolver to find the endpoint based on IP and port instead of building the endpoint directly. Not sure why it failed but now it's more robust.~~ Final version hasn't been tested in Windows please @iFuSiiOnzZ let me know if it fails. Fixes #761. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04 * **Python version(s):** 2.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.19 - - - **EDIT** So the problem wasn't what I thought initially the quick test I did succeeded for a different reason. I still couldn't test it on Windows though. Anyway I found a flaw in my original design of the streaming library. To give a bit of context this is how it works. When you create a sensor through the RPC channel this creates a new "stream" in the streaming server and connects the sensor to it so it sends the data through the stream. Each stream has a token used by a streaming client to subscribe to the stream. The token contains the endpoint (ip address + port) for the client to connect and read the data. The problem is that I was using the same endpoint that I use to connect the server (localhost). Somehow this worked on Linux because we only tested in the same computer but maybe Windows is not accepting this (I'm still not sure if it will accept the new version). Now I added more flexibility so the token may not contain any address info (only port) or may contain a different endpoint (say you want to connect through a different IP address or maybe in the future the stream is on a different computer). If it doesn't have an address (this is by default) a fallback address is used in this case the same address used by the RPC server. I also rolled back the resolver part because already have a fixed endpoint we don't need to resolve anything (at least not at that point). --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/763)

Title: Lens distortion shader
Body: #### Description Added a new lens distortion shader. If needed works alongside with other post-processing materials. Successfully tested with depth and semantic segmentation. ![lens](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15848712/45484327-ff686380-b753-11e8-9f55-5663fb911723.gif) Fixes #754 #### How to test 1. Create a new `Post Process Volume` and make it bigger. 1. Go to its Details `Rendering Features > Post Process Materials` and add 2 elements in the array. 1. For each one click `Choose` and select `Asset reference`. 1. In the first one search for _LensDisortion_ and test it (with the camera inside the _Volume_). 1. For the second one search for another post-processing material and test that is correctly working. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Windows * **Python version(s):** - * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.19 #### Possible Drawbacks Make sure to disable the chromatic aberration when using it with another post-processing to avoid corrupting your data. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/776)

Title: Improvements to streaming library
Body: #### Description I made some refactoring of the streaming library to accommodate the changes of #750. It includes some important performance improvements avoids an unnecessary extra copy of the data sent and re-uses allocated memory when possible. I replaced the Message class by a more generic Buffer class. A Buffer is basically a unique pointer to a piece of raw memory the type is move-only to avoid copies and if created by BufferPool the allocated memory will go back to the pool once the Buffer is destroyed. I added a BufferPool to each stream (to each sensor as there is one stream per sensor) so the buffers used by a single stream can be re-used. The memory of the buffer is allocated on demand if there is not enough capacity but since our sensors send messages of fixed-size (or almost like lidar) the allocations should happen very rarely. The benchmark shows that the time of writing a message to a stream has been reduced a bit for small messages but significantly for big messages (up to half the time for 1080p images at 60FPS). #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04 * **Python version(s):** 2.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.19 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/783)

Title: New sensor system that aims to make easier adding new sensors
Body: #### Description The idea is to create a new sensor system that allows contributors to "plug in" their implementations easily. 1. Add a sensor actor. 2. Add a sensor serializer (and possibly a sensor data view in Python). 3. Register the classes. All the details below. This PR fixes: - Fixes #750 Plugin system for adding new sensors. - Fixes #687 Add Lidar to new API. - I have also removed all the legacy sensor code. **TODO:** - [x] Test that the sensor transform received is in world coordinates. - [ ] Test the resulting images on Windows and if possible with Vulkan. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04 * **Python version(s):** 2.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.19 #### Possible Drawbacks I've refactored some of the code that reads the image buffers and fixed a possible bug this part is a bit tricky and should be tested in Windows to make sure everything works as expected (in Linux does) i.e. getting some images with different (odd) sizes in the client side to see they make sense. - - - ## Mini tutorial This are the steps to add a new sensor (I will add a tutorial with more detail soon): #### 1. Sensor Actor Create a sensor actor deriving from `ASensor` (or one of its derived classes) this class requires to implement the following methods: - `static FActorDefinition GetSensorDefinition();` Returns an actor definition that will be given to the user in the client-side to configure the details of the sensor. - `void Set(const FActorDescription &ActorDescription) override;` Configure the sensor with the attributes that the user requested. - `void Tick(float DeltaTime) override;` This function is called on every game update and here the sensor is expected to produce the data and send it (more on this below). - Also requires the UE4 macros `UCLASS()` and `GENERATED_BODY()`. The following sensor classes are already implemented here: `ASceneCaptureCamera` `ADepthCamera` `ASemanticSegmentationCamera` and `ARayCastLidar`. This class should be added to `Unreal/CarlaUE4/Plugins/Carla/Source/Carla/Sensor` folder. `ASensor` contains a `FDataStream` for sending the data through the streaming server. Sensor actors should write their measurements to this stream using one of the two methods in the stream `Send_Async` or `Send_GameThread` depending in which thread they're producing the data. The class `FDataStream` is quite well documented take a look for more details. The stream methods won't compile however until the sensor and its serializer are registered which takes us to the next class required. #### 2. Sensor Serializer This class is in charge of serializing and deserializing the data. The only requirement of this class is providing two static methods with the following signatures: - `static Buffer Serialize(const YourASensor &sensor ...data here...);` This function should convert the data provided by the sensor actor into a `Buffer` object. The signature is quite open. - `static SharedPtr Deserialize(RawData data);` This function has to convert a `RawData` object (which is a wrapper around a buffer with some extra meta-information) into a `SensorData` derived class. Serialization happens in the simulator-side right after writing the data to the stream. Deserialization happens in the client-side right after delivering the data to the user in the callback function provided to the `listen` method of the sensors. This class should be added to `LibCarla/source/carla/sensor/s11n` folder and its corresponding namespace. There are already some `SensorData` classes implemented like images and arrays otherwise you must add a new class fitting your needs. In this case the class must also be exposed to Python. I will add more info on this in the tutorial. #### 3. Register your classes Your classes must be registered within the `SensorRegistry` as an `std::pair`. Also follow the steps in the header as the includes must be added in the right places. ```cpp // LibCarla/source/carla/sensor/SensorRegistry.h using SensorRegistry = CompositeSerializer< std::pair std::pair std::pair std::pair >; ``` And that's it the sensor registry now do its compile-time magic to dispatch the right data to the right serializer. Well ok I might have missing something. We will be polishing this guide as we start playing around with new sensors. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/830)

Title: Fix client receives interleaved sensor messages
Body: #### Description Requires #750. See description and comments in #815. I have removed the part that "re-posts" a message when the socket is busy. Now it simply ignores the message. It is a bit drastic but reduces latency on client considerably when connection is slow plus this won't be a problem once we enable the synchronous mode. I have also tweaked the unit tests to reflect that we can miss messages. Fixes #815. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04 and Windows 10 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.19 #### Drawbacks Some messages are lost if the connection is too slow. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/854)

Title: Add IO methods for sensor data
Body: #### Description Requires #815. Adds the following methods to the API: * Image: `save_to_disk(filename color_converter=None)` saves the image to disk applying the given color converter. Available formats PNG TIFF and JPEG (JPEG has losses though). * Image: `convert(color_converter)` Apply the given color converter in place. * LidarMeasurement: `save_to_disk(filename)` Saves the point cloud in PLY format. The following color converters are available: - `None` - `Depth` - `LogarithmicDepth` - `CityScapesPalette` Related issues: - Fix #821. - Fix #751. - Fix #851. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04 * **Python version(s):** 2.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.19 Needs to be tested on Windows though. #### Drawbacks Adds the following dependencies `libpng16-dev` `libtiff5-dev` and `libjpeg-dev`. The build system can be tweaked to support only one of them. Travis build is changed because travis does not support `libpng16`. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/855)

Title: Client side improvements
Body: #### Description Requires #829 and all its dependencies. Includes a bunch of different improvements to the client-side code: - Related to #810 C++ API has been refactored hopefully easier to use now although it still needs to be polished to be linkable to other apps but it's a step forward. - Fix #809 release GIL whenever possible (this has really improved performance of the Python API thanks @harlowja for reporting!). - Make possible to unsubscribe from a sensor (in Python sensors now have a `stop()` method). - Fix #843 Streaming client keeps trying to reconnect after destroying a sensor. - Fix #767 Deadlock when closing the simulator while a client is connected (or at least one of them). - Fix crash on simulator shutdown if a client has connected at some point. - Related to #784 vehicle control and set transform methods are now sent async which greatly improves performance in the client-side (we still want to add batch mode though). - Vehicle control is cached and not sent if haven't changed. Now it's possible to call `vehicle.apply_control(...)` continuously and the message will only be sent when necessary. Plus I redesigned the Python examples: - `example.py` is gone now there is a `tutorial.py` in which a simple example on how to use the API is commented step by step. - `manual_control.py`now has a fancy user interface (for Carla standards :wink:) and in general the driving experience should be smoother. Although you still depend on a simulator running fast the input is captured at a decent frame rate. It is also possible to change the main view between the different cameras available. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04 * **Python version(s):** 2.7 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/856)

Title: Improve manual control steering
Body: #### Description Currently when the left or right key was pressed the wheels were steering to the maximum angle making the car a bit hard to control. Now initially the wheels steer 0.2% which will increase over the time until reaching the maximum steering point. This way we get a more smooth driving experience. Blocked by #821. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Windows 10 x64 1803 * **Python version(s):** 3.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.19 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/829)

Title: Fix ply file format for PCL reading
Body: The PCL reader cannot directly read the .ply file generated by Carla. It will pop up an error message "cannot reading header". After trying several times I found that it is due to the lack of line break at the end of the file. This pr will fix this. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9154441/45587623-34042880-b8d6-11e8-964c-66a060b59746.png) --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/781)

Title: Move PythonClient inside deprecated folder
Body: #### Description A lot of people is getting confused because we currently have two Python client related folders. We don't want to remove the old client yet because a lot of functionality haven't been ported to the new API but we want to make clear that this client is deprecated. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4332953/47563801-420c8680-d923-11e8-9f56-5deec214bca0.png) --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/912)

Title: A few changes for 0 9 1
Body: ## Description Massive PR with lots of changes required for 0.9.1. ###### User-side improvements - New map Town03 now set as default map. - Support for Python 3 on Linux. - Add "dynamic_weather.py" script that changes the weather in real-time. - More improvements to "manual_control.py" support for changing weather the camera view and the vehicle. - Add an option to command-line to change quality level when launching the simulator. ###### API changes - API methods for retrieving and changing weather conditions and lighting `world.get_weather()` and `world.set_weather(params)`. Add `carla.WeatherParametes` class that parametrizes the weather conditions and add weather presets to it: `carla.WeatherParametes.ClearNoon` etc. - Remove `client.ping()` `client.get_server_version()` accomplishes the same. - Add support for requesting the list of actors alive in the current world `world.get_actors()`. Returns an `ActorList` object behaves like a list but has `filter` functionality and lazy initialization of Actors. - Add id (id of current episode) and map name to `carla.World` class - Rename `contains_X()` methods to `has_X()`. - Add `semantic_tags` to Actors containing the list of tags of all of its components (these tags match the tags retrieved by the semantic segmentation sensor). - Add a "tick" message containing info of all the actors in the scene this is executed in the background and cached. This way calls to `actor.get_transform()` or `actor.get_location()` do not need to connect with the simulator but can access the cached info. This makes these calls quite cheap. - Add `world.wait_for_tick()` and `world.on_tick(callback)` methods for synchronizing the client with simulator updates. Both methods return/pass a `carla.Timestamp` object containing frame count delta time of last tick global simulation time and OS timestamp. - Add `actor.get_velocity()` and `actor.get_acceleration()` these are also cached so its quite cheap to get them. - Add bounding boxes to vehicles `vehicle.bounding_box` property. - Function to enable/disable simulating physics on an actor `actor.set_simulate_physics(enabled=True)`. - Expose traffic lights and signs as actors. Traffic lights have a specialized actor class that has the traffic light state (red green yellow) as property. - Add methods for accessing and modifying individual items in `carla.Image` (pixels) and `carla.LidarMeasurement` (locations). - Add collision event sensor "sensor.other.collision" that triggers a callback on each collision to the actor it is attached to. The callback receives a `carla.CollisionEvent` containing the actor it collided to and the normal impulse of the collision. - Add `carla.Vector3D` to generalize `carla.Location`. ###### Other C++ improvements - Add multi-streams for streaming simultaneously to multiple clients (used by the "tick" message). - Refactor of client-side code: - Add Simulator class shared by all the API objects that decides whether to call the server or retrieve a cached value. Leave `detail::Client` for pure networking operations only. - Add concept of episode to facilitate restarting episodes and changing map in the future. - Add `EpisodeProxy` that allows access to Simulator only if the episode hasn't changed. - More geom classes `geom::Vector3D` and `geom::BoundingBox`. - More synchronization classes `AtomicSharedPtr` `RecurrentSharedFuture` `CallbackList`. - Add `ActorVariant` for lazy initialization of Actors. - Add `CachedActorList` for caching Actor descriptions and reduce call to the server. - Small refactor of quality level related stuff and ported to new game mode. - Adjust camera gamma to 2.4 (by @TheNihilisticRobot). - Add MsgPack class and functions to serialize rpc objects into/from `Buffer`. - Add `AWorldObserver` sensor and its serializer for serializing all the actors registered in the episode and sending the "tick" message. - Add `ACollisionSensor` and its serializer for detecting collisions. - Add `not_spawnable` tag for sensors that cannot be spawned by the client (e.g. world observer). - Allow vehicles without color attribute to support vehicles that cannot change its color. - Archive Python eggs on Jenkins - Fine grained targets in Makefile compilation times reduced by compiling only what's necessary. - Add uncrustify config file for formatting UE4 C++ code. - Add support for ".gtest" file each line of this file is passed to GTest executables as arguments when running `make check` targets. Very handy for filtering test while developing. - Update Content assets package link which solves a lot of issues related with the assets. ###### Fixes - Fix wildcard filtering issues now "vehicle.*" or "*bmw*" patterns work too. - Fix `actor.set_transform()` broken for attached actors. - Fix None is a reserved keyword in Python 3 rename `carla.ColorConverter.None` to `carla.ColorConverter.Raw`. - Workaround for setup.py to link against libcarla_client again (Linux only) - Fix leaking objects in simulation when despawning a vehicle. Now pawn's controller is destroyed if necessary when destroying an Actor. - Suppress exceptions in destructors. ## Issues that fixes - Fix #13 Collisions are not annotated when vehicle's speed is low. - Fix #35 SplineMeshRepeater loses its collider mesh. - Fix #496 Issues with two-wheeled vehicles. - Fix #572 Set the max distance culling for foliage. - Fix #576 Adjust pedestrian animations. - Fix #577 Adjust vehicle physics. - Fix #649 Filenames too long. - Fix #692 Overflow on platform time-stamp. - Fix #698 Compiling for Python 3. - Fix #749 Allow controlling the weather from the client-side. - Fix #822 Allow disabling actor physics. - Fix #857 Set transform of actor attached to another one should be relative. ## Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04 * **Python version(s):** 2.7 and 3.5 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.19 ## Possible Drawbacks Definitively. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/915)

Title: Get config loading working again for abs paths
Body: The main reason this wasn't working was because it was only returning true for the relative path; when it should return true in both cases. Fixes #215 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/919)

Title: Allow drawing UE4 debug shapes from Python API
Body: #### Description Allow drawing debug primitives from Python API some examples ```py world.debug.draw_point(carla.Location(1 2 3)) world.debug.draw_line(carla.Location() carla.Location(x=10) color=carla.Color(0 255 0)) world.debug.draw_string(carla.Location(z=4) "Hello!") ``` Draw bounding box ```py transform = vehicle.get_transform() bounding_box = vehicle.bounding_box bounding_box.location += transform.location world.debug.draw_box(bounding_box transform.rotation) ``` #### API ```py draw_point(location size=0.1 color={Red} life_time=-1.0 persistent_lines=True) draw_line(begin end thickness=0.1 color={Red} life_time=-1.0 persistent_lines=True) draw_arrow(begin end thickness=0.1 arrow_size=0.1 color={Red} life_time=-1.0 persistent_lines=True) draw_box(box rotation thickness=0.1 color={Red} life_time=-1.0 persistent_lines=True) draw_string(location text draw_shadow=False color={Red} life_time=-1.0 persistent_lines=True) ``` --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/921)

I have upgraded rpclib to the commit that fixes this. @iFuSiiOnzZ Please check the Windows script. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/928)

Title: Road lane next prev
Body: #### Description Currently given a lane from a road segment there is no way to know which is the next or previous lane. The missing information has been added as is needed for the PythonAPI. Each road section has a function called `GetNextLane` and `GetPrevLane` that accepts as input the current lane and return a vector of pairs where the first element of the pair is the next lane id and the second one the next road id. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/938)

Title: Fix prev next lane
Body: #### Description Roads are connected between directly or using junctions. The lane connection between roads was wrong in some cases some time the information was missing and other times was points to wrong or non-existent lane. #### Possible Drawbacks Need more testing --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/958)

Now the last control applied to a vehicle (autopilot or otherwise) can be retrieved in Python with the `get_vehicle_control()` method of vehicles. Also moved traffic light state to rpc so it can be serialized as part as the "type dependent dynamic state" of actors. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04 * **Python version(s):** 2.7 and 3.5 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.19 #### Possible Drawbacks The world observer message becomes bigger thus may reduce performance. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/954)

Title: Road information based on OpenDrive
Body: #### Description Work-in-progress branch for the generation of waypoints based on OpenDRIVE files + a lot of tiny fixes for 0.9.1. - Add an OpenDrive file parser. - Add our custom map classes for easily handling OpenDrive data. - Expose these map classes to Python API (Map and Waypoint). ###### Other fixes/changes - Fix FileSystem to accept paths without parent folder. - Fix several issues with the Windows compilation. - Fix wrong map name is returned when playing in editor. - Fix camera position in vehicle_gallery.py. - Fix #953 UE4 circular dependency warning. - Add recommended spawn points to Python scripts. - Add Lidar view to manual_control.py - Add spawn_npc.py. - Add OpenDrive files for each of our maps. - Add OpenDriveActor to automatically generate route planners based on OpenDrive data. - Make vehicles continue straight when off-road. Fixes #601. Fixes #969. #### TODO - [ ] Move 3rd party files out of `LibCarla/source/carla` see e.g. moodycamel (maybe we can make a "third-party" folder). - [ ] @iFuSiiOnzZ Please follow coding convention you can use `make pretty ARGS=-f/path/to/file` to correct indentation. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/936)

Title: Append to Travis build logs instead of over writing
Body: #### Description The Travis build logs were being overwritten at each make step. If any step failed only the current step's output is shown (upto 2000 lines). Which is okay assuming the failure is only with the current step but often it is useful to have the full build log (or at least the last 2000 lines from the combined log). This PR simply appends the stdout & stderr from all the make steps into `build.log` instead of over-writing to provide verbose build error logs. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/957)

Title: Fix win32 compilation
Body: #### Description Depending on the included headers sometimes the compilation was failing giving errors as ` {instrinsic funtion} is not a member of {class name}` or some Unreal functions as `GetObject` was replaced by the `GetObjectW` macro of Windows. So to fix the problem some of the general Unreal includes and some other unused includes have been removed. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/988)

Title: Move ROS bridge to its own repo

Title: Initial version Carla ROS bridge
Body: The parent property of an actor via python interface is not yet filled. Therefore the parent_id of Actors has to be transferred from the CARLA server via rpc interface. Changes in detail: carla/rpc/Actor.h: - add parent_id field to the Actor class for rpc transport TheNewCarlaServer.cpp: - fill the parent_id field with the appropriate value client/ActorList: - added GetActor() function to get an actor by id client/ActorVariant: - added actor_list optional parameter to Get() and MakeActor() function which allows to query for the parent actor in case the actor_list is available Checklist: - [X] Your branch is up-to-date with the `master` branch and tested with latest changes - [ ] Extended the README / documentation if necessary - [X] Code compiles correctly - [x] All tests passing with `make check` #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04 * **Python version(s):** 2.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.19 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/981)

Title: Provide parent attribute content of Actors via python interface
Body: While creating the new carla ros bridge some extensions became necessary within CARLA: The parent property of an actor via python interface is not yet filled. Therefore the parent_id of Actors has to be transferred from the CARLA server via rpc interface. In addition actor attributes are published via python interface. Changes in detail: carla/rpc/Actor.h: - add parent_id field to the Actor class for rpc transport TheNewCarlaServer.cpp: - fill the parent_id field with the appropriate value client/ActorList: - added GetActor() function to get an actor by id client/ActorVariant: - added actor_list optional parameter to Get() and MakeActor() function which allows to query for the parent actor in case the actor_list is available client/ActorAttribute: - solved problem of independent rpc::ActorAttribute* classes by introduction of ActorAttributeValueAccess class to be able to reuse most of the functions for both ActorAttribueValues and ActorAttributes ActorBlueprintFunctionLibrary: - extended actor attributes by attribute 'role_name' having {autopilot scenario ego_vehicle} as recommended values for vehicles or {front back ...} for sensors to be able to distiguish the different actors in a meaningful way when transferring to ROS topic names - extended vehicle attributes by not-modifiable attribute 'object_type' to be defined at blueprint creation time to provide ground truth object classification type PythonAPI: - libcarla: provide the actor attributes within python as dictionary - make use of role_name attribute to provide information required for ROS bridge to distinguish ego vehicle from others #### Description Fixes # #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** ... * **Python version(s):** ... * **Unreal Engine version(s):** ... #### Possible Drawbacks --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1008)

Title: Osi grpc communication2
Body: **Feature Request** _Adding new module osi_grpc_communication_module._ **Description** - The module provides a standardized interface to connect CARLA with third party tools. - Module uses the gRPC (google remote procedure call) to send the groundtruth measurement data of the host_vehicle and the non_player_agents (vehicles) with OSI standardization (Open Simulation Interface) at every frame in the episode. - All the proto_to_python generated files are present with the module. they can be readily used for the compilation and working. - the origional .proto files are also present for the manipulaiton and advancement. - osi_grpc.proto is used to generate the .py version of the request with protoc and a special gRPC plugin **Where has this been tested?** - **Platform(s):** Windows 10 x64 - **Python version(s):** Python 3.6 - **Unreal Engine version(s):** UE 4.18.3 - **- CARLA version(s):** 0.8.4 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/963)

Checklist: - [x] Your branch is up-to-date with the `master` branch and tested with latest changes - [x] Extended the README / documentation if necessary - [x] Code compiles correctly - [x] All tests passing with `make check` Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04 * **Python version(s):** Python 2.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** Unreal 4.19 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/980)

Title: Improved OpenDriveActor
Body: #### Description Fixes and improvements on OpenDriveActor especially for the final user the artists: - Fixed an issue where you could end with repeated road networks - Added an option to spawn `AVehicleSpawnPoint` upper each trigger box on a variable distance - Now the road network and the spawners are serialized so you can reload a scene and continue editing it properly - Now you can create and destroy the road network automatically and not by hand - Now the `RoutePlanner` have it's trigger box properly aligned with the road's direction - Added a functionality to show or hide a debug version of the generated road network - Added minimal interface and basic integration with Unreal Editor + Added buttons to configure the parameters and generate/delete the driving network + Now the Actor can be selected focused and moved around the map + Added an icon to easily find and visualize the actor on the viewport #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Linux 16.04 * **Python version(s):** * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.19 #### Possible Drawbacks After generating the road network all the RoutePlanners does not have a properly spline visualization. You can work-around it selecting and moving the `RoutePlanner` and then executing and Undo `Ctrl+Z`. It's not caused by this PR but it's good to know. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1014)

Title: Basic pedestrian control
Body: #### Description Added support for spawning and controlling "walkers" from the Python API. - [x] New control object "WalkerControl" consisting of direction (world coordinates) speed (m/s) and jump (boolean). - [x] New actor type "Walker" with bounding box and "apply_control" and "get_control" methods. - [x] Helpers for creating pedestrian definitions in the Walker factory in UE4. - [x] New UE4 controller class "WalkerController" that allows controlling an ACharacter with "WalkerControl". - [x] Renamed "get_vehicle_control" to "get_control". - [x] Update manual_control.py to allow controlling walkers. Notes: - I use the term walkers as general walking characters (in case we add animals in the future) and pedestrian as specific subtype of walker. - This PR **does not add any walker** only support for them. It has been tested but the final pedestrians have to be added to the content repository. Fixes #748. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04 and Windows 10 * **Python version(s):** 2.7 3.5 and 3.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.19 #### Possible Drawbacks > **It may break user code!!** Renamed "get_vehicle_control" to "get_control" to have a generic method name available for all different types of actors. Thus "vehicle.get_vehicle_control()" is no longer available scripts making use of this should replace it by "vehicle.get_control()". - - - --> Download here a [demo build with place-holder pedestrians](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1GsAa1ZdhvvuFEHYAK9fv4GCRLE0T_ot2). (manual_control.py modified to run as pedestrian). --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1157)

Title: Upgrade to UE4 21
Body: Upgrading Carla from 4.19 to 4.21. - [UE4.20 Release Notes](https://docs.unrealengine.com/en-US/Builds/4_20) - [UE4.21 Release Notes](https://docs.unrealengine.com/en-US/Builds/4_21) Fixes several things including the issues with the strange popping of vegetation on Linux. It breaks somehow our road shader creating some weird visual artifacts until we fix this it will be replaced by a less fancy but more efficient version. In order to upgrade (Linux) - Install `clang-6.0` and set as default compiler. - Download and compile UE4.21. - Update your `UE4_ROOT` environment variable. - Rebuild Carla. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1170)

Title: Issue 1056
Body: #### Description Added a few methods to manage an actor physics from python API: - set_velocity - get_angular_velocity - set_angular_velocity - add_force - add_impulse Fixes #1056 #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Linux * **Python version(s):** 2.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.19 #### Possible Drawbacks The vectors applied (velocity angular velocity impulse and force) are defined all in worlds coordinates so if you need to apply them relative to the actor we need to transform before applying. For example to apply a relative forward force we can use: # get vehicle orientation transform = vehicle.get_transform() # define the force vector (in world coordinates) force = carla.Vector3D(5000 0 0) # make force relative to the vehicle transform.transform(force) # apply the force vehicle.add_force(force) --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1126)

Title: Fix TCP accept error Too many open files
Body: #### Description Fixes #1119. We were keeping unnecessary references to expired server sessions thus keeping these sessions alive and their sockets open. I made sure streams and sessions are discarded when the sensor is destroyed. Note also that we need to explicitly remove the stream on end play since the sensor actor is not actually destructed until UE4 garbage collector kicks in. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1150)

Title: Runtime assets and scenarios load
Body: #### Description Changed the make process and added some script in order to cook maps from the content folder "/Game/Carla/ExportedMaps/" and pack them in a different file so they can be distributed separately from the main application. It will create a folder under the root of Carla called ExportedMaps and place the packed maps there. Also there is a helper for decompressing the files and placing them in the right position inside the target distribution in which the new maps will be used. Fixes # #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Linux * **Python version(s):** Python not involved * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.19 4.21 #### Possible Drawbacks Distributed builds won't use paks files. This might mean slower copies as now it will copy every cooked file instead of a big one. Nothing more as it does not affect directly the project it does not change nothing apart from creating a couple of folders. The worst case would be that in which you have changes in the distribution asset and override them with a new asset because one of the new maps need a new version of that asset. Luckily that would only happen on a distribution build so it can be easily fixed. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1172)

Title: Remove crash reporter
Body: #### Description Remove UE4 crash reporter from the packaged version. By default UE4 includes a crash reporter in packaged builds however since we don't use it it's only causing noise in the output and stalling the simulator after a crash. Related to #1111. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1176)

Title: A few fixes for 0 9 3
Body: #### Description A collection of changes that fix a few critical things * Includes changes of #1150 but fixes a bug that became apparent after those changes. The streams were not kept alive when sending data async that caused crashes after destroying sensors. Now I made sure the FAsyncDataStream is safe to be called both sync (game-thread) and async. * Improved simulator fatal error handling now uses UE4 fatal error system. E.g. better output when the address is already in use (#1111). * Fixed lost error messages in client-side now when a request fails it reports the reason (#1095 #1111). * Fixed crash when an actor was destroyed but not deregistered e.g. falling out of world bounds (#1168). * Exceptions have been removed from LibCarla server pipeline now we compile with `-fno-exceptions`. Dependencies have been updated to avoid exception all but rpclib this one still uses exceptions. This may gives us problems but removing exceptions would require to modify the library so for now we are postponing this. * Replaced all "throw" occurrences by "carla::throw_exception" now all the exceptions including in Boost library are re-routed through "carla::throw_exception". * Reduced compilation time of LibCarla.server. * Split unit test since we need to compile both with and without exceptions divided into server client or common. * Added adaptors to serialize boost::variant and boost::optional with MsgPack. This improves significantly serialized size of DebugShapes. We could use it too for rpc::Actor though not implemented here. * Added a new template class Response every rpc call to the simulator is now replied with a Response. Responses may contain a value or an error string. * Added `UCarlaStatic` for a collection of util static methods for UE4 code and blueprints. #### Fixes - Fixes #1119. - Fixes #1168. - Fixes #1095. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04 * **Python version(s):** 2.7 and 3.5 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.21 #### Possible Drawbacks Core functionality has been modified careful testing is needed. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1184)

Title: Add movable static meshes to the actor registry
Body: #### Description Make possible to control movable objects already present in the map e.g. chairs and tables in Town01 ![moving_props](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4332953/52855788-c11c0980-3122-11e9-9499-1e08d8ab1461.gif) ```python props = [(x x.get_transform()) for x in world.get_actors().filter("static.prop*")] for actor _ in props: actor.add_impulse(carla.Vector3D(z=1.5)) actor.set_angular_velocity(carla.Vector3D(z=14000)) time.sleep(0.3) for actor _ in props: actor.set_simulate_physics(False) time.sleep(3) for actor transform in props: actor.set_transform(transform) ``` What I did is parsing the scene at begin play and adding every static mesh that is movable to the actor registry so they're visible in the API as actors. #### Possible Drawbacks If art team forgets to set an unwanted object as "static" in UE4Editor this object will show up in the API. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1256)

Title: Improve time out error messages and fix 1151
Body: #### Description - Improved time-out error messages now instead of an rpc error you get the following message ``` RuntimeError: time-out of 2000ms while waiting for the simulator make sure the simulator is ready and connected to 127.0.0.1:2000 ``` - Print same error message if we meet the time-out in `world.wait_for_tick` (RecurrentSharedFuture) previously the message was very cryptic. - Wait for tick after subscribing to the world observer to have the world ready after `client.get_world()` solves issues of having an empty list when calling `world.get_actors()` right after creating the world. Fixes #1151. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1257)

Title: New expose vehicle physics
Body: #### Description This pull request includes the feature of controlling the *physics properties* of vehicles and wheels. These properties can be controlled through a `VehiclePhysicsControl` object which also contain the ability to control each wheel's physics through `WheelPhysicsControl` object. The physics properties of `WheelPhysicsControl` are: - Tire Friction - Wheel Damping - Steer Angle - Enable Steering The physics properties of `VehiclePhysicsControl` are: - Engine Torque Curve - Engine Maximum Revolutions Per Minute - Engine Moment Of Inertia - Damping Rate during Full Throttle - Damping Rate during Zero Throttle when clutch is engaged - Damping Rate during Zero Throttle when clutch is disengaged - Use Automatic Transmission - Gear Switch Time - Clutch Strength - Mass - Drag Coefficient - Center of Mass - Steering Curve - List of `WheelPhysicsControl` Fixes # #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04LTS * **Python version(s):** Python 2.7.12 and Python 3.5.2 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.21.2 #### Possible Drawbacks --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1301)

Title: Expose traffic sign s trigger volumes on Python API
Body: #### Description Since the traffic sign information is not yet present in the OpenDrive files it is not possible to determine which road lanes are affected by traffic lights/signs. As a workaround I'm exposing the trigger volumes that our UE4 autopilot uses for detecting traffic signs. This way it is possible to deduce in Python which waypoints are affected by traffic signs by testing against their trigger volumes. But again this is a workaround we want to have this info attached to waypoints in the future since this could be computed offline just based on the OpenDrive file. Changes: - Adds new Python actor TrafficSign and re-parents TrafficLight actor - Adds a `trigger_volume` property to TrafficSign actors - Hides `GetBoundingBox()` from C++ Actor's interface as most actors do not have bounding box For this to work traffic sign blueprints should be updated with ![output](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4332953/52484661-3170db00-2bb7-11e9-805f-abe632032a03.gif) I haven't made the changes in the art repo cause they would cause conflicts with other unmerged PRs. But I made I build for testing with the blueprints changed running `no_rendering_mode.py` will display the trigger volumes ---> [Get build here](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1vl66AZDkZ1Egd6IYD9gCAcFEFHf0YAwF) <--- #### Drawbacks @XGodina Some trigger volumes are rotated in editor unfortunately the rotation info cannot be sent to Python with our current system we should remove this rotation in editor. ![trigger](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4332953/52484682-3df53380-2bb7-11e9-9076-93648262c936.png) --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1228)

Title: Added traffic lights groups to the API
Body: Updating API to allow retrieval of traffic pole index and the other traffic lights in a group from a traffic light. #### Description These changes allow the user to get all the traffic lights in the group a traffic light is in. These traffic lights can be accessed from any instance of a TrafficLight class. The user can now also get the index of the traffic pole the traffic light belongs to. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Linux * **Python version(s):** 2.7 3.4 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.21 #### Possible Drawbacks None --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1202)

Title: Bernatx recorder
Body: #### Description Added Recording / Replayer functionality to the server. Now we can record the simulation to a file and replay it at any time. Any actor created or destroyed during recording will be replicated also when replaying. Child of #596 #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Linux Ubuntu 16.04 * **Python version(s):** Python 2.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.21 #### Possible Drawbacks Only events like actor creation destruction and reparenting are recorded and also the position and orientation of each actor in scene (we could derive velocity from positions). So that information is what can be replayed so far. More information will be added to the recorder file in next version (like traffic lights weather...) When the replayer finishes it enables the autopilot to all existing actors and some can go lost around because they don't find a target to go. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1223)

This lets users to visualize easily when a traffic light is affecting the hero vehicle. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04 LTS * **Python version(s):** Python 2.7.12 and Python 3.5.2 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** ... #### Possible Drawbacks This will **only** work once the `Expose traffic sign's trigger volumes on Python API` pull request is merged. Otherwise traffic lights **will not** get illuminated at all in hero mode. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1314)

Title: Features for 0 9 4
Body: I'm sorry I did it again. To avoid merge conflicts I rebased everything into a single PR. #### Changing map at runtime from client-side The following API functions were added to the Client object - `get_available_maps()` Retrieves a list with the paths of all the maps available to the simulator (dynamically finds all the maps available at runtime) thanks to @dnovillo-CVC. - `load_map(map_name)` Loads the map given this resets the whole simulation to start anew. `map_name` can be either a full path or the name of a city in our maps folder i.e. "Town02" is equivalent to "/Game/Carla/Maps/Town02". Returns the newly load world. - `reload_map()` Reloads the current map (equivalent to `load_map("")`). ```py world = client.load_world('Town05') ``` Bear in mind that any reference to an actor belonging to the previous world will be invalidated. Trying to operate with an actor from an old world results in an exception. Callbacks added to `world.on_tick(...)` are removed. #### Synchronous mode Synchronous mode is back! when synchronous mode is enabled the simulator waits every update until a client gives the order to continue. Synchronous mode can be enabled at any time via world settings (see below). Once enabled the client is responsible of calling ```py client.tick() ``` every time is ready to continue with the next simulation update. In order to add this I had have to enforce an strict "tick order" to all the relevant Carla actors. Things happen like this now 1. Send world tick (transforms velocities etc.) used by wait_for_tick 2. Update UE4 actors (autopilot traffic lights etc.) 3. Parse client requests 4. If sync-mode and client did not tick repeat 3. I have worked hard to avoid any kind of dead-lock between client and server but I wouldn't be surprised if there are still some situations resulting in total block. Please report if you find one of those! #### Batch commands Finally we have a way of sending commands in batch. This is not only more efficient but also allows to apply a command to every actor in the same tick e.g. sending the control to every NPC vehicle or why not making all the cars jump at the same instant. ```py actors = [x for x in world.world.get_actors() if x.id != world.player.id] client.apply_batch([carla.command.ApplyVelocity(x.id carla.Vector3D(z=5)) for x in actors]) batch = [carla.command.SetAutopilot(x.id False) for x in actors] batch += [carla.command.ApplyVehicleControl(x.id carla.VehicleControl(throttle=1.0)) for x in actors] client.apply_batch(batch) ``` The following batch commands are available (they're under `carla.command` module) * `DestroyActor(actor_id)` * `ApplyVehicleControl(actor_id `control)` * `ApplyWalkerControl(actor_id `control)` * `ApplyTransform(actor_id `transform)` * `ApplyVelocity(actor_id `velocity)` * `ApplyAngularVelocity(actor_id `angular_velocity)` * `ApplyImpulse(actor_id `impulse)` * `SetSimulatePhysics(actor_id `enabled)` * `SetAutopilot(actor_id `enabled)` #### World settings Added world settings this settings can be changed at any time and have effect immediately. At this point only two settings are available * `carla.WorldSettings` - `synchronous_mode` - `no_rendering_mode` and use them like this ```py settings = world.get_settings() settings.no_rendering_mode = True world.apply_settings(settings) ``` #### Support for random streaming port Now it is possible to control the secondary port used for streaming the sensor data. So far this port was always set to RPC port + 1 now it is possible to specify this port and even let the OS to chose a random available port for you by settings it to 0. The client will automatically connect as this info is sent through the RPC port. These port are configured when launching the simulator ``` ./CarlaUE4.sh -carla-rpc-port=2000 -carla-streaming-port=0 ``` #### Non-sticky vehicle control I added an attribute to vehicle blueprints to specify whether the applied control is "sticky". By default is set to "True" i.e. the behaviour we always had. ```py bp.set_attribute("sticky_control" "False") ``` When "sticky_control" is "False" the control is reset every frame to its default (throttle=0 steer=0 brake=0). So unless the client sends a control message the vehicle will eventually stop. In the future we would like to add more realistic relaxation curves for this control but we wanted to release this already so users can start experimenting with it and hopefully give some feedback on how to improve it. ## Fixes - #1258 Ensure tick order. - #1244 Synchronous mode. - #1272 Allow changing map from client-side. - #784 Control over multiple vehicles in batch mode. - Fixed a few synchronization issues that appeared once restarting an episode was possible. - Reduced overhead of many RPC calls by sending only actor IDs (instead of serializing all the actor attributes every time). - Added priority system for vehicle control input. - Make episodes have a random unique id to avoid collisions between runs. - Finally got rid of Example.CarlaSettings.ini you can still use it but it's no longer necessary. - Also updated the link to the content with latest fixes from art. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1322)

Title: Waypoint API extended
Body: #### Description Extended the waypoint API with new functions: - `carla.Waypoint.lane_change`: Returns a `carla.LaneChange`. - `carla.LaneChange`: A Python enum that tells whether traffic rules allow a lane change. + 0: `None` + 1: `Right` + 2: `Left` + 3: `Both` + Can be used as a flag e.g.: * `LaneChange.Right & LaneChange.None => False` * `LaneChange.Right & LaneChange.Left => False` * `LaneChange.Right & LaneChange.Both => True` * `LaneChange.Right & LaneChange.Right => True` - `carla.Waypoint.lane_type`: Returns an string that codifies the type of the current lane e.g.: `"driving" "bidirectional" "shoulder" "sidewalk" "median" "parking" "none" ...` - `carla.Waypoint.get_right_lane()`: Returns another `carla.Waypoint` (although the rules allow the change or not) at the closest right neighbor lane. If there is no right lane it returns `None`. - `carla.Waypoint.get_left_lane()`: Returns another `carla.Waypoint` (although the rules allow the change or not) at the closest left neighbor lane. If there is no left lane it returns `None`. Notice that if the new waypoint is on a different signed `lane_id` it does mean that it's in the opposite direction. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Linux * **Python version(s):** 2.7 & 3.5 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.21 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1320)

Title: Add method to Map to transform Location to GeoLocation
Body: Refactored a bit the code to reuse the functionality in GNSS sensor moved the parsing to the OpenDrive parser and the geo-location transformation to the new GeoLocation class so we can easily convert Locations (x y z) to GeoLocations (latitude longitude altitude). Add `transform_to_geolocation` to the Python API's Map so we can convert any location to the GNSS coordinates without parsing the OpenDrive file ```py geoloc = map.transform_to_geolocation(location) ``` and also exposed the GeoLocation class in Python. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1355)

Title: Add waypoint id and s
Body: #### Description Added a hash function for waypoints taking into account its road_id lane_id and "s" offset. The "s" offset is truncated to half centimetre precision. I have also added the "s" property to waypoints that was the last piece missing to uniquely identify a waypoint in the OpenDrive format. #### Possible Drawbacks Theoretically the hash could have collisions as we are hashing to 64 bits but unlikely enough about 1 in 10^5 for the typical amount of waypoints you can generate in our cities. There aren't collisions in our current towns I tested to be sure :grin:. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1365)

Title: Add timestamp to SensorData
Body: #### Description Until now SensorData only had the frame_number. This might be sufficient for a lot of use cases but it's a pain to work with in ROS (using the carla-ros-bridge) ROS is reliant on time e.g. transforms (ros-tf) are calculated by specifying a time. The workaround to match a specific frame_number with the time would be cumbersome. Therefore the timestamp is now added to SensorData. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1348)
