Title: Light API
Body: ## Description A new Light Manager has been created to control the lights of the city. The light manager can be accessed through World: ```py lm = world.get_lightmanager() ``` It is possible to set and get different properties of the lights and can be accessed one by one or grouping different lights on a list: ```py lights = lm.get_all_lights() # Setting the lights one by one for light in lights: light.set_color(carla.Color(128 255 64)) light.set_intensity( 50000.0) # The same with the lights grouped lm.set_color(carla.Color(128 255 64)) lm.set_intensity( 50000.0) ``` Example of turning on all the lights of the building group: ```py lm.turn_on(lm.get_all_lights(carla.LightGroup.Building)) ``` Example changing the first 4 lights without a group: ```py lm.set_light_groups( lm.get_all_lights(carla.LightGroup.None) [carla.LightGroup.Street carla.LightGroup.Street carla.LightGroup.Building carla.LightGroup.Other] ) ``` #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 2 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/2756)

Instead I will stop all vehicles to avoid them go crazy. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Windows * **Python version(s):** 2.7 3.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** UE 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks Probably we will re-enable this feature in the future with a better communication client-server --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/2754)

Title: Better build script
Body: #### Description I have inserted more checks in the **build.sh** and **build.bat** scripts that generates the binary file for the pedestrians navigation. Now they can work with only some of the required files (.fbx .xodr or .obj) - if .fbx is given the script try to convert to .obj. But for this to work the user need to install the **FBX SDK** from Autodesk and compile the **FBX2OBJ** for which we give the source. Also to run the FBX2OBJ we need in the same folder the shared libraries from Autodesk FBX SDK (**libfbxsdk.so** or **libfbxsdk.dll**) - if .obj is given it will be processed at the end for the Recast calculation - if .xodr is given then a script will extract all the zones that are crosswalks and they will be added as meshes (planes) to the .obj (if exist) or the .obj will be created with them. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16 18 and Windows 10 * **Python version(s):** 2.7 and 3.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** UE 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks To generate the binary file from the FBX we need to install Autodesk FBX SDK and compile the given source for FBX2OBJ and then place the .SO or .DLL from Autodesk to the folder **Carla/Util/DockerUtils/dist/**. To avoid this step we need to provide the FBX as an OBJ file using for example the Carla Exporter. We can not do that automatically because of the Autodesk license that the user needs to agree. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/2774)

Title: Exposed car lights to client
Body: #### Description Now the vehicle lights can be turned on and off from the client-side. `manual_control.py` has been updated to allow this too so feel free to experiment with it. Open the help panel (`H` key) for more information. You will need the latest art repo to work with cars that have lights implemented. Right now they are: Tesla **Model3** **Cybertruck** (yup :wink:) and the Volkswagen **T3** To control them from the client we exposed the `VehicleLightState` that is an enum that works as a flag container. The values are: - Position - LowBeam - HighBeam - Brake - RightBlinker - LeftBlinker - Reverse - Fog - Interior - Special1 - Special2 _The special ones are reserved to car specific lights (like ambulance sirens)_ An example opening the position light and low beam light from some vehicle: ```py # Decide which ones do we want to open adding these flags lights_to_open = carla.VehicleLightState( carla.VehicleLightState.Position | carla.VehicleLightState.LowBeam) # Set the state of the car lights to match the flag we created vehicle.set_light_state(lights_to_open) ``` #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3.6 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.22 #### Possible Drawbacks You can experiment with performance issues when enabling big amount of lights. This is more an Unreal/Art issue but should be taken into consideration while using the API. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/2414)

Title: Fix windows script to find UE4 directory
Body: #### Description In Windows build there was a discrepancy on how to get the Unreal Engine directory so we now use two methods together: - First it tries to use the environment variable **UE4_ROOT**. If that variable is defined then we use it. - If the UE4_ROOT is not defined then we search on the windows registry for all keys inside: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\EpicGames\Unreal Engine\ the result could be: 4.21 4.22 4.23 4.24 then we use always the last one following the order on the registry so probably the last installed version of UE will be the one to use. We get the **InstalledDirectory** of that version and we can continue. If all these methods fail the we can not make the windows build. Fixes # 2776 #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Windows * **Python version(s):** - * **Unreal Engine version(s):** UE 4.24 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/2784)

Title: New API function to add angular impulse to an actor
Body: #### Description New API function **actor.add_angular_impulse(vector)** It sends an angular impulse to the actor. The **vector** has this characteristics: * in **world** coordinates * in **degree** units * defines the **axis** of rotation * the magnitude is the **strength** of the impulse It takes into account the **mass** of the actor so for massive actors you need bigger impulse (magnitude of the vector). You can use it as a function like: `actor.add_angular_impulse(carla.Vector3D(0 100 0))` or as a command batch: `batch = []` `batch.append(carla.command.ApplyAngularImpulse(actor carla.Vector3D(0 100 0)))` `client.apply_batch(batch True)` Both will apply an angular impulse of 100 degrees on the world Y axis (pitch). #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Windows 10 * **Python version(s):** Python 3.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** UE 4.24 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/2813)

Title: Fixed IMU gravity
Body: #### Description On the IMU sensor there was an issue where acceleration due to gravity was added after rotating the actor acceleration vector to the orientation of the IMU. This meant that there was a constant 9.8 m/s^2 added to the Z axis of the accelerometer readings regardless of the orientation of the accelerometer. This PR changes this so that gravity is added to the Z axis before rotation. Fixes #2790 #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 2.7 3.6 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks If any code has been written to explicitly account for this error it could break. However anyone using an IMU in a Z-up orientation (the default) will see almost no changes. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/2795)

Title: Map optimizations
Body: #### Description Exposed functions `get_right_vector` and `get_up_vector` to python API. Fixed large RAM usage in `GeometryPoly3` and `GeometryParamPoly3`. Now the geometry is discretized in fewer segments. In UE4 side the OpenDRIVE map was multiple times by different objects. Now only the `ACarlaGameModeBase` class holds the map and other objects should request the map with `UCarlaStatics::GetGameMode(WorldContextObject)->GetMap()`. Modified conversion functions from `std::string` to `FString` in `String.h`. The conversion is becomes slightly slower but allows very large string to be converted back and forth. The function `Map::GenerateChunkedMesh` now takes `OpendriveGenerationParameters` as argument as some parameters were not used or passed to this function. Pedestrian navigation can be now switched in `OpendriveGenerationParameters` as for large maps Recast uses too many resources. Improved mesh separation in standalone mode. Now the world is divided in a uniform grid of side `OpendriveGenerationParameters::max_road_length`. Every mesh within the grid is merged to a single mesh to improve performance and reduce draw calls. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 2 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** UE4.24 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/2877)

Title: Traffic manager 2 0
Body: #### Description New architecture for the traffic manager to improve correctness efficiency and maintainability. A big part of this endeavor has been to isolate usage of carla::client::* types for simulation data access from the core operations of traffic manager to improve efficiency by using locally cached simulation state and static attributes in simple custom types. The new design also allows for easier implementation of per-vehicle multi-threading on stage operations and provides better data structure organization for external API access. Below are some highlights of the submitted changes: * **Agent life cycle and state management** module caches the simulation state into simple custom types and performs necessary setup vehicle life cycle management and clean up at the beginning of each update cycle. * Each stage of the system has a simplified and uniform interface to allow cleaning up invalidated actor references related data and resetting internal state when flushing traffic manager state. * New class structures with better scope organization of common data structures for easier data sharing among various stages. * Revamped intersection anticipation algorithm using waypoint occupancy tracking. * Corrected frame-to-frame synchronization with the simulator in synchronous and hybrid physics mode of operation. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 16.04 20.04 * **Python version(s):** 2.7 3.5 3.8 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/2833)

Title: Raycast parallelization

The output data is unchanged and the only difference is the performance of the sensor in the server side and therefore the number of points_per_second that sensors can achieve in reasonable computational time is higher. Title: Basic build system for Windows
Body: #### Description A basic build system for Windows. **This PR provides** - Support for Python3 (`make PythonAPI`) - Automated download and build of `zlib` and `libpng` needed in Win - Now Boost is downloaded from `https` and not from git **This PR does NOT provides** - Support for Python2 (not tested really) - Support for Google Test Fixes #1000 Fixes #1155 Fixes #976 #### Full test of functionalities 1. Open a `Visual Studio x64 Native Tools Command Prompt` and navigate to the project folder 1. Remove `carla/Build` folder (if exists) 1. Run `make clean launch` 1. Make a package using the Editor (`File > Package Project > Windows > x64`) and close it 1. Run the generated package (`CarlaUE4.exe`) 1. Run `make PythonAPI` 1. Navigate to the PythonAPI dir (`cd PythonAPI`) 1. Run `python manual_control.py` and record some images (using `r`) to test that everything works as expected #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Windows10 * **Python version(s):** 3.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.21 #### Possible Drawbacks Credentials problem using `https` (see #647) I hope this does not break anything on Linux :) --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1241)

Title: Added timeout function to spawn_npc py script Resolves 2999

Title: All streams are multi stream now
Body: #### Description Now sensors are multi stream by default. That means that one sensor can be listened from different clients to get the same data. Sensors are optimized for one single stream (using atomic variable) but if they get more connections then they switch to multi stream mode (using mutex instead of atomic). So one client can create a sensor for example: ``` bp = world.get_blueprint_library().find('sensor.other.gnss') gnss_sensor = world.spawn_actor(bp carla.Transform()) gnss_sensor.listen(lambda event: my_callback(event)) ``` and then from another client we can get that sensor and listen to it: ``` actors = world.get_actors() for actor in actors: if (actor.type_id == "sensor.other.gnss"): actor.listen(lambda event: my_callback(event)) ``` Both clients will get the same data. Fixes # 2597 #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Windows * **Python version(s):** 3.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** UE 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks The multi stream works only from different client connections. If we want to use multi-stream from the same client it is recommended to get the data only once and then in the callback propagate the data where is required. The downside of using multi-stream in the same client connection is that when you stop the sensor from listening (sensor.stop()) then all the streams from that client connection will be stopped. We don't have a way with current Python API to choose which stream we want to stop so we stop all of them (from the same client only). --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/2937)

Title: Recorder extensions
Body: #### Description Added features to recorder: vehicle light state and scene light events. The recorder will write the state of the lights of vehicles at every frame and will record the state of the static lights in the scene whenever they are changed as an event system. In addition this adds a id for lights a content update is required. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 2 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3002)

Title: Zlib correctly statically linked
Body: #### Description Some people had issues with the following error while running the client: ``` ImportError: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found. ``` This is an issue with `zlib` that was not correctly statically linked. A workaround was putting a x64 `zlib.dll` on `carla/PythonAPI` folder. This is not necessary anymore because `zlib` is correctly statically linked now. Fixes #1345 #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Win10 * **Python version(s):** 3.x * **Unreal Engine version(s):** - --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1350)

Also since the raycast is now ignoring several other channels this could improve the performance. Title: Lens distortion shader
Body: #### Description Now all the camera-based sensors are provided with and additional lens distortion shader. You can see the effect of just increasing the `lens_circle_multiplier` value to `1.0` - `2.0` or so. ```py camera_bp.set_attribute('lens_circle_falloff' str(5.0)) camera_bp.set_attribute('lens_circle_multiplier' str(0.0)) camera_bp.set_attribute('lens_k' str(-1.0)) camera_bp.set_attribute('lens_kcube' str(0.0)) camera_bp.set_attribute('lens_x_size' str(0.08)) camera_bp.set_attribute('lens_y_size' str(0.08)) ``` Also exposed chromatic aberration for `sensor.camera.rgb`: ```py rgb_camera_bp.set_attribute('chromatic_aberration_intensity' str(0.5)) # 0.0 by default rgb_camera_bp.set_attribute('chromatic_aberration_offset' str(0.0)) ``` Changed `manual_control.py` so you can visualize a lens distortion example pressing `8`. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 2 & 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.22 #### Possible Drawbacks Slightly more GPU consumption since this shader is applied now by default. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/2145)

Title: Fix Windows build Batch Files proper handling of input back slash
Body: …es spaces #### Description Fixes initial Windows Build I solved many errors in Windows batch files in order to build CARLA for the first time. - Added double-quotes for path variables in order to handle spaces in path names. - Most directory variables now contain backslashes only except CMAKE variables and `ROOT_PATH` and `INSTALLATION_DIR` from `Util\BuildTools\Windows.mk`. - Git and b2 don't like backslashes at the end. `:~0 -1%` eliminates them - `:\=/` converts all backslashes to slashes - `:/=\` convert all slashes to backslashes - added missing `shift`s while processing parameter - `%~dpn` become resolved to absolute drive path name and converts slashes to backslashes - `[]` checks produced errors if variable was empty #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Windows 10 CMD.exe * **Visual Studio:** 2017 Professional (v141) * **Windows SDK:** 10.0.17763.0 * **GNU Make:** 3.81a * **Python version(s):** Python 3.7.2 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24.3 #### Possible Drawbacks Other branches or forks can run into errors if they have a modified version because of expecting/missing (back)slashes. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/2959)

Title: Traffic light fixes
Body: #### Description Reworked traffic light system now all traffic lights use `UTrafficLightComponent` to control their behavior (solves many determinism issues). The recorder now only "ticks" on the posttick event in the `FCarlaEngine`. Reworked `ATrafficLightManager` to register traffic lights from OpenDRIVE and existing lights in the editor. Remade frozen behavior now it affects all traffic lights in the map and it works using the `ATrafficLightManager`. A new function in carla.World has been added to implement this functionality and the `traffic_light.freeze(True)` function in individual traffic lights now affect all of them as well (the function is left for code compatibility). Fixed a bug that caused traffic lights in standalone mode to be missing in the client side. Fixes #2793 #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 2 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** UE4.24 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3041)

Title: Added configurable noise to Lidar sensor
Body: #### Description Other sensors such as the IMU and GPS have configurable noise. This PR adds configurable noise to the Lidar sensor. The noise is simulated by randomly perturbing each point along the vector of the laser ray. In effect this simulates a Lidar with perfect angular positioning of each ray but noisy distance measurements. The scale of this noise is controlled by the new `noise_stddev` attribute. It defaults to 0 so the default behavior is identical to the old behavior. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 2.7 3.6 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks This noise model might not be completely accurate to real life Lidar sensors which presumably also have some noise in the angular position of each raycast. However it is probably a good first step. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3001)

Title: Proof of concept for building CARLA with Bazel
Body: #### Description This is an experiment I did for building CARLA with [Bazel](https://docs.bazel.build) I'm sharing here what I got in case there is interest into going this way. This is not a complete build of CARLA on Bazel at the moment only LibCarla and PythonAPI are built including their unit tests but it already comes with some perks. ![carla-bazel](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4332953/78471222-f1ac7180-772f-11ea-9843-e22b2b71ebee.png) Some pros of building with Bazel: * Bazel helps a lot ensuring build correctness IMO that's its strongest point. All the dependencies need to be explicitly declared which can be a bit annoying while developing but ensures you're not including by mistake files from your machine. You could also ensure reproducible builds completely independently of the host machine. This is not ensured in this PR but it gets some steps closer some dependencies are not longer needed like clang & llvm libpng or libjpeg. * Incremental builds can be trusted unlike with our current build system. That means we can start doing incremental builds on CI build times can be significantly reduced depending on the set of files changed could go down to seconds on some cases. Moreover not only builds but also testing is done incrementally if the test binary doesn't change the test is cached that again can reduce a lot the CI pipeline loads. Also pretty nice during development. * Fresh builds are also faster (on beefy machines...) even though it compiles and tests more things. This is because everything now runs in parallel from setup to tests. On a i9 CPU: ```sh # Running unit tests (release) on a freshly cloned repo. make check.PythonAPI check.LibCarla.release ~ 5m50s (Python 2.7 3.6) bazel test ... ~ 2m40s (Python 2.7 3.6 3.7 3.8) ``` * Python wheels and eggs are generated for each version of Python installed on the host machine. In the same way unit tests are run for each version. The way is built is a bit cleaner too instead of letting the setup.py build the native code we build the .so with Bazel that gives us more control and we could now stop that horribly slow single-file build we have on the Python API. Python dependencies are not yet handled in this PR so you need to manually pip install nose2 and setuptools for all versions. * Unifies client and server builds everything is built now with the toolchain included in Unreal Engine this way ensures we always link with the exact same toolchain and STL. This could also be done as well with the current build system btw but bazel makes it a bit easier to ensure you include the right files. The client-side then links C++ runtime statically but as it turns out we're already doing that in the current build. * Unifies Windows Linux and macOS builds (potentially). This PR is linux only but Linux specific parts have been reduced to just few places. * libpng and libjpeg are downloaded and built too that should solve all the issues related to libpng versions missmatch. TIFF support is dropped atm. * Bazel disk cache feature allows to share cached results among copies of the same repo that means you can have several clones of Carla in your machine and things will only be downloaded and compiled once. For that add a `.user.bazelrc` to the repo with ``` build --disk_cache=~/.cache/carla/disk build --repository_cache=~/.cache/carla/repo ``` * The Bazel build can co-exist with the current build system the set of files is completely different the few changes in the code I've made are totally compatible and some actually fix issues and circular dependencies also for the current system. If we ever wanted to switch to Bazel it could be done progressively. #### Some Bazel usage examples ```sh # Build everything. bazel build ... # Test everything. bazel test ... # Test everything in debug. bazel test -c dbg ... # Test only LibCarla. bazel test //LibCarla/... # Run specific test or binary passing arguments. bazel run //LibCarla/source/test:geom -- --gtest_filter='*rotation' # Run tests a thousand times useful for finding flaky tests (which btw we have). bazel test //PythonAPI/... --runs_per_test=1000 # Clean. bazel clean # Clean including downloads. bazel clean --expunge # Visualize dependency graph. bazel query 'deps(//PythonAPI:dist)' --output graph | dot -Tpng > graph.png ``` #### Install Python wheels ```sh # Automatically install the right version of the API. python -m pip install --use-wheel --no-index --find-links=bazel-bin/PythonAPI/ carla # and test it. python -c "import carla; print(carla.Client('localhost' 2000).get_client_version())" ``` #### Sanitizers Sanitizers are pretty amazing already found 6 bugs just enabling them. The dbg build runs with [UBSan](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/UndefinedBehaviorSanitizer.html) by default it'll crash if undefined behavior is encountered. Additionally [ASan](https://clang.llvm.org/docs/AddressSanitizer.html) can also be enabled to find memory leaks and memory access issues however this one doesn't work with Python atm so it is disabled by default to test with both enabled ```sh bazel test -c dbg --features=asan --test_tag_filters=-python //... ``` Currently running under gdb seems broken in bazel the following works to run any script and break on a UBSan error ```sh $ bazel build -c dbg //PythonAPI:dist $ python3 -m pip install --use-wheel --no-index --find-links=bazel-bin/PythonAPI/ carla $ gdb --args python3 ./PythonAPI/examples/manual_control.py (gdb) break __ubsan::ScopedReport::~ScopedReport (gdb) r ... (gdb) q $ python3 -m pip uninstall -y carla ``` --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/2693)

Title: Fixed global planner s RoadOptions
Body: ### Description **Before** RoadOptions were calculated from the angle between the direction of the entering road and the "net vector" (vector between the start of the intersection and the end). **Now** the "net vector" has been substituted by the angle of the existing road. This helps deal with irregular intersection where some roads are very wide and other are very narrow (due to the difference in the amount of lanes). Here are some HD images showing the idea. Before (1st one was accepted as LEFT but the second wasn't): ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58212725/88901224-d28e9e00-d250-11ea-9c8c-9743472db5f8.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58212725/88902145-1635d780-d252-11ea-9454-5db714dbde8c.png) After: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/58212725/88901014-88a5b800-d250-11ea-84f1-2053605c54d9.png) **Bonus change:** The manual control has a left panel with the closest vehicles. Added a clause that forces the comparison to only use the distances not the vehicle itself (as they can't be compared resulting in an error). #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3.6 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3137)

Title: Dsantoso lidar rawdata
Body: #### Description Introduced a new sensor that gives the computed information of the LiDAR in a 'raw' manner. This include the position of the cloud point the cosine of the incident angle respect to the normal of the surface of the collided object the id of the actor and its semantic tag. The new sensor is called RawLidar and can be instantiated via 'sensor.lidar.ray_cast_raw'. it has not include the computation of the intensity the drop off of points or the noise computation. It also important to notice that it has a performance loss respect to the normal RayCastLidar. In this PR the normal RayCastLidar has been rewritten to inherit from the RayCastRawLidar but it performance should be comparable or slightly higher than previously. It also includes a new script (PythonAPI/examples/open3d.py) to visualize both LiDARs in 3D in real time with colors both for the intensity and the semantic tags via @marcgpuig Fixes # #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 / Windows 10 * **Python version(s):** 2.7/3.6.9 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks None --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3131)

Title: Improved scene capture pipeline
Body: #### Description Some improvements have been applied to the render pipeline of the capture sensors: - Instead of flushing the GPU each time a sensor renders the scene these are enqueued until the last sensor of the frame performs all the GPU-CPU sync and copies the textures. This avoids intermediate flushes on the GPU and syncs between the CPU and the CPU. - The buffer where the texture has to be copied is pooled now. Also a stat command has been added to the server to measure the capture cost: `stat CarlaSensor` #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 2 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 Warning! This PR will remain in draft until is tested on Windows. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/2928)

Title: Remove unnecessary resource locking by reducing the level of parallel
Body: …ism in the inner loop. Checklist: - [x] Your branch is up-to-date with the `master` branch and tested with latest changes - [x] Extended the README / documentation if necessary - [x] Code compiles correctly - [ ] All tests passing with `make check`: ``` [ FAILED ] 1 test listed below: [ FAILED ] benchmark_streaming.image_1920x1080_mt ``` (not sure if this is caused by this change as it also fails on master branch on my machine) - [x] If relevant update CHANGELOG.md with your changes #### Description This PR makes the parallelization more coarse (switching from task-per-point to task-per-channel) allowing me to remove the mutex for the critical section that deals with emplacement of elements as each task now emplaces the elements into it's own vector separate vector. Result of running `python raycast_sensor_testing.py -ln 1 -ln 0 --profiling` Before the change: https://pastebin.com/RSxhKx90 After the change: https://pastebin.com/Y5R8v6iy Result of running `python raycast_sensor_testing.py -sln 1 -ln 0 --profiling` Before the change: https://pastebin.com/Hk7av3F1 After the change: https://pastebin.com/dziSeVd4 We can observe a noticeable difference in performance for the non-semantic lidar and on-par or better performance on the semantic lidar likely due to the fact that the hit registration is a more expensive computation for the semantic lidar (as per discussion with Daniel Santos) therefore making it so that the threads spend less time contending for the mutex since they have more work to the before getting to it. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** Python 3.6 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** Unreal 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks Not only does this improve the performance but it also simplifies the source code. Therefore I do not see any obvious drawbacks. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3169)

Title: Building Carla on Ubuntu 20 04 LTS
Body: #### Description Most of the instructions for building Carla on Ubuntu 18.04 works for 20.04 as well except for dropping Python 2.7 related dependencies. Like so: ``` sudo apt-get install build-essential clang-8 lld-8 g++-7 cmake ninja-build libvulkan1 python3 python3-pip python3-dev libpng-dev libtiff5-dev libjpeg-dev tzdata sed curl unzip autoconf libtool rsync libxml2-dev && pip3 install --user setuptools ``` Build scripts are also modified to remove Python 2.7 targets. One could manually install Python 2.7 and retain support for it but it's probably better to just let go of it. P.S. No need to add Xenial or Bionic deb repository which is the first command in the build instructions in the [docs](https://carla.readthedocs.io/en/latest/build_linux/) i.e ``` sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install wget software-properties-common && sudo add-apt-repository ppa:ubuntu-toolchain-r/test && wget -O - https://apt.llvm.org/llvm-snapshot.gpg.key|sudo apt-key add - && sudo apt-add-repository "deb http://apt.llvm.org/xenial/ llvm-toolchain-xenial-8 main" && sudo apt-get update ``` I was able to build Carla on Ubuntu 20.04 with only Focal Fossa deb repository. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 20.04 * **Python version(s):** 3.8 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks * To run scripts that use pygame need to use pygame developent version 2.0.0.dev6 as 1.9.6 can't be installed from pip on Python 3.8. ``` pip3 install pygame==2.0.0.dev6 ``` --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/2787)

Title: Fix for random camera crash
Body: #### Description Fixed a random crash on the simulation that appeared after a while. The cameras logic were rolled back to the reordering logic. This means that the cameras are being rendered at the end of the frame to avoid intermediate flushes on the GPU pipeline. The atlas code and logic were removed for readability and maintenance. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3306)

Title: Fix a local planner bug when changing its route
Body: ### Description The local planner route is divided in two parts. The first part is the *waypoint_buffer* which englobes the very first waypoints. The rest are part of the *waypoint_queue*. **Previously** when resetting the route the *waypoint_queue* was reset but not the buffer causing the new route to be composed of the previous buffer + the new route. **Now** the buffer is also reset. As a note when testing I **haven't detected any issues with the current agents** as the buffer is very small and the planner is smart enough to remove the waypoint that are behind the actor but this was definitely a problem if someone used the planner with large buffers. Also I have additionally changed the local planner of the **Behavior Agent** to account for this error too. However this agent can add waypoints to the route so the buffer doesn't always have to be reset only when the previous route is cleaned. ### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3.6 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 ### Possible Drawbacks None that I can think of --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3264)

Title: Fixed ugly z fighting issue with OSM maps
Body: #### Description This PR fixes issues of z-fighting in OSM maps where short roads with very high curvature can be generated producing visible issues in standalone mode. The normal vector of the mesh vertices is checked to be pointing upwards and inverted if this condition is not met as road geometry should always point towards the sky. This also adds a new small actor `AProceduralMeshActor` which allows for better inspection in the editor. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks The geometry of the walls is also checked but as their normals are perpendicular to the vertical direction they shouldn't be affected. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3297)

Title: sergi e api snipets
Body: #### Description - New feature for the PythonAPI reference: code snipets available for some methods. - The snipet appears on the right side of the window (empty by default in Read the Docs). - It includes the name of the method a code snipet and a reference image if necessary. - The name of the snipet file and its image should correspond exactly with the methods' name such as: `carla.World.spawn_actor`. - `doc_gen_snipets.py` creates a div to contain the snipets and the a series of div with snipet content. - Existing snipets are contained in `/PythonAPI/docs/snipets/` as `.py`. - `doc_gen.py` appends the content inside the .md created by doc_gen_snipets.py and deletes it. - the snipets buttons are responsive and disappear if the window size is less than a certain value. - snipet images are stored in `/Docs/img/snipets_images/` - Code snipets now replace the code recipes reference. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04.4 * **Python version(s):** 3.6.9 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks - Snipets shouldn't be inexistent for narrow windows. Title: Spawn actors in batch
Body: #### Description Added methods to spawn actor in batch mode reducing the number of accidents related to vehicles spawning on top of each other. * Added new `carla.command.SpawnActor` to spawn actors in batch * Added method `client.apply_batch_sync` that waits for server response * Updated `spawn_npc.py` to spawn vehicles in batch The `SpawnActor` command also accepts queuing commands to be applied to the newly spawned actor. ```py batch.append( SpawnActor(blueprint transform).then( SetAutopilot(FutureActor True)).then( ApplyVelocity(FutureActor Vector3D(z=5)))) ``` `spawn_npc.py` has been updated to spawn all the vehicles in batch but now it does not support spawning more vehicles than spawn points. This is probably a good thing due to the amount of accidents that it was producing. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/1489)

Title: Fix dead lock in synchronous mode at high frame rate
Body: #### Description Fixed a dead lock in synchronous mode happening randomly at high frame rate. It was caused by a race condition between messages to be sent through the network (the message causing the dead-lock was the one who has the episode data). The messages are added in a queue and processed in order. While one is being sending a flag is marked and then the flag is unmarked once the message has been sent. But the unmarking of the flag was coded in a handler that was added to the queue when the message has been sent instead of processing it at the instant. That was producing the race condition when another message was added to the queue before this handler because if the flag is not unmarked the next message will be discarded. In the case of a message with the episode data if it is skipped in synchronous mode then the client will never receive that episode and will wait forever while the server will never receive another tick so both will be in dead-lock. The fixes just do two things: * communicate to the stream server in which mode the server is running (synchronous or asynchronous) * process the handler of a message sent at the instant instead of adding to the queue. * in synchronous mode the server will wait until he can send a message (wait for the flag unmarked) * in asynchronous mode we will skip sending a message while flag is marked (for slow networks) Fixes # 2809 #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Windows * **Python version(s):** 3.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks None --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3394)

Title: Enable disable environment objects
Body: #### Description There has been added two calls to the PythonAPI to get and control the object placed in the level: - `get_environment_objects` retrieves all the objects of the level - `enable_environment_objects`call to enable/disable objects of the level For the objects of the level has been added a new class `EnvironmentObject` that contains: - Name of the object (Actor name in Unreal) - Unique ID (64 bit hashed name) - Transform Example of use: ``` #Retrieve all the objects of the level env_objects = world.get_environment_objects() # doesn't have filter by type yet env_object_ids = [] for obj in env_objects: env_object_ids.append(obj.id) print(obj) # print info if you want # Disable all the objects world.enable_environment_objects(env_object_ids False) # Enable all the objects world.enable_environment_objects(env_object_ids True) ``` #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3445)

Body: #### Description New API functions: `world.cast_ray()` `world.project_point` `world.ground_projection()`. Title: Adding load control on sublevels
Body: #### Description There have been added two new functions to control the layers being loaded on the map: `load_map_layer` and `unload_map_layer`. This only works in new maps that were created with sub-levelling in UE. Does not perform any actions in old maps. There have been updated too the `load_world` to support this feature so the client is able to configure the sublayers when the map is loaded. To select the sublayers a new enum has been added `carla.MapLayer`. This enum works as a bitfield making it possible to select more than one layer at once. The `manual_control.py` script has been updated with this feature working as a testing scenario and example for users. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3515)

Title: TrafficLight and TrafficSigns can spawn on sublevels
Body: #### Description The TL (TrafficLight) and TS (TrafficSigns) were spawned from code always to the persistent level. Now before spawning them it is detected if the level support sub-levelling and if the right sublevel exists so they can be spawned in the right level. If there are no sublevels or the specific sublevel is not included in the hierarchy they will be added to the persistent level as before. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3532)

Title: Fixed update_information method of BehaviorAgent does not work with an instance of carla libcarla World class
Body: #### Description The `update_information` method of the `BehaviorAgent` currently takes as input an instance of the `World` class defined in `automatic_control.py`. Therefore the user can't use this agent independent of the `World` class in the provided example. According to the documentation of the method the `update_information` requires an instance of `carla.world` however `carla.libcarla.World` does not have a player attribute. To fix this issue and use `BehaviorAgent` outside of the Carla `automatic_control.py` example I simply removed the world parameter from the method signature and instead used the `self.vehicle` attribute. I also changed the `automatic_control.py` accordingly to reflect the new signature of the `update_information` method. Fixes # #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s): Ubuntu 20.04 * **Python version(s): 3.8 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3566)

The initial surface of the window has been set to black to avoid this. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3608)

Title: Improved enable disable of environment objects
Body: #### Description This feature has been improved to control each mesh instead of the whole actor. Similar to the BB calculation. In fact the BB can also be queried from the EnvironmentObject and the BoundingBoxCalculator has been updated to support this feature and now we can get the components that compose a BB (ie: traffic lights) The API remains exactly the same. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks This feature only works on not spawned actors --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3563)

Title: Add horizontal fov parameter to lidar sensor
Body: #### Description Added a "horizontal_fov" parameter to (semantic) lidar to allow for a restricted field of view of the sensor. The field of view is centered around the axis in which the sensor is directed. The rotation frequency parameter is scaled towards the total fov of the sensor meaning it describes the frequency for one full scan of the fov. Fixes #1440 #1544 #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04.5 * **Python version(s):** 3.6.9 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24.3 #### Possible Drawbacks With a default 360° horizontal FOV the lidar scan will start at -180° and finish at 180° when performing a full revolution assuming the sensor itself is at a 0° orientation. Previously the scan would in this case start at 0° and finish at 360°. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3525)

Title: convert html tables to markdown tables and fixing table styles
Body:
#### Description I noticed that there are `` tags and `
` and `` elements within .md files. These HTML tags render properly on [browsers](https://carla.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) but make it difficult to convert the documents into other formats (PDF EPUB etc) using standard tools like pandoc as I tried [here](https://github.com/ebadi/mkdocs2book). I tried to convert these table tags into standard markdown table formats as suggested in the [mkdocs user guide]( https://www.mkdocs.org/user-guide/writing-your-docs/#tableshere) Fixes #3589 #3617 #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Firefox & Chromium on Linux --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3614)

Title: Toggle ragdoll physics Upgrade PhysXVehicle for sweep wheel collisions
Body: #### Description This PR combines 2 features: 1) Added `WorldSettings.deterministic_ragdolls` to enable or disable ragdoll physics and death animations. For now this only has an effect with content branch `axel/ragdoll_animations`. 2) We have upgrade the PhysXVehicle plugin of Unreal to allow for sweep collision for wheels. This results in much more realistic wheel-road interaction this is important especially in curbs but have a performance hit. This is disabled by default but it can be enable at any moment throught the physics control of the vehicle: ``` physics_control = vehicle.get_physics_control() physics_control.use_sweep_wheel_collision = True vehicle.apply_physics_control(physics_control) ``` Fixes # #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks If enabled it is expected to have a performance hit. If it not everyhing should works as previously. This requires the Unreal Engine to be patch (in the PhysXVehicle plugin) so it will require to build the Engine from source in Windows. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3662)

This is disabled by default but it can be enable at any moment throught the physics control of the vehicle: ``` physics_control = vehicle.get_physics_control() physics_control.use_sweep_wheel_collision = True vehicle.apply_physics_control(physics_control) ``` Fixes # #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** Python 3.6 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** Unreal 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks If enabled it is expected to have a performance hit. Title: Extended local planner with a lateral offset
Body: ### Description Added an offset input to the VehiclePIDController allowing the controlled vehicles to move displaced from the lane center. The LocalPlanner has been extended to accomodate these changes. It is important to note that due to the current state of the controllers they are subject to break if the offset is high enough to make the vehicle drive through an adjacent lane. This is mainly due to the use of functions such as *get_waypoint()* or *is_at_traffic_light()*. ### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3.6 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 ### Possible Drawbacks There should be no possible drawbacks as this is purely an extension. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3678)

It requires the `Pillow` Python module in order to store the result as an image. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3.6 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3454)

Title: Corkyw10 integrate markdown extension
Body: The dropdowns were all broken due to the mixture of markdown and html. I used the extension for mkdocs "md_in_html" [1]. We can use this to allow for inline syntax to be rendered using markdown (links strong emphasis etc). The reason we can only use it for inline syntax and not block level content on this page is because of the way the extension works with nested html tags. It's not possible to do if we want the html tags of details and summary to work well together (having the header show next to the dropdown arrow) but I think this gives a good balance. [1]: https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/md_in_html/ --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3682)

Title: Adding optimized maps to the package
Body: #### Description Added the optimized maps into the main package of CARLA: - /Game/Carla/Maps/Town01_Opt - /Game/Carla/Maps/Town02_Opt - /Game/Carla/Maps/Town03_Opt - /Game/Carla/Maps/Town04_Opt - /Game/Carla/Maps/Town05_Opt The rest of the optimized maps will be packaged in individual files. The main reason is that we need to specify all the maps + sub-levels to cook and that info comes in a string bigger than the command line limits of Windows system (around 1024 chars). So there is the AdditionalMaps package with the (normal) maps - /Game/Carla/Maps/Town06 - /Game/Carla/Maps/Town07 - /Game/Carla/Maps/Town10HD and then three individual packages with the optimized maps: - /Game/Carla/Maps/Town06_Opt - /Game/Carla/Maps/Town07_Opt - /Game/Carla/Maps/Town10HD_Opt #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18 Windows 10 * **Python version(s):** 3.7 2 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks Increase the size of the main package --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3546)

This solution should be improved. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04.4 * **Python version(s):** 3.6.9 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks - The title displayed when opening a snipet needs some work. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3461)

Title: Converting html tags table image link etc into markdown
Body: #### Description "Markdown is designed to be easy to write and to read the content should be publishable as-is as plain text without looking like it has been marked up with tags or formatting instructions." therefore HTML/JS/CSS is not recommended (while supported) to be used in markdown files. This PR convert HTML tags with their Markdown equivalents. In long term this PR enables other tools like Pandoc to work properly with these markdown files. Html tags (table image link etc.) are converted into markdown. Fixes #3589 #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Linux Chromium and Firefox * **Python version(s):** ... * **Unreal Engine version(s):** ... #### Possible Drawbacks --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3629)

Title: Fixing build for Python 3 9 deprecation error
Body: #### Description Fixes compilation of PythonAPI on Python 3.9.0. `PyEval_InitThreads()` has been deprecated since Python 3.7. The thread initialization is now done on `Py_Initialize()` for Python 3.7 and 3.8 (see the [documentation](https://docs.python.org/3/c-api/init.html#c.PyEval_InitThreads) for info on thread initialization). I just made the compilation conditional so that it is performed for Python 3.6 and lower. Fixes #3637 #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 20.04.1 LTS (Focal) * **Python version(s):** Python 3.9.0 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** Unreal Engine 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks None --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3636)

Title: Added actor offset for carsim simulation
Body: #### Description This PR fixes the issue of CarSim having a different coordinate origin than our vehicles. When CarSim is enabled it adds a new empty actor to the scene with an offset with the actual vehicle to match CarSim's coordinate origin. Then the CarSim component is added to the empty actor to control it and the vehicle is attached to the empty actor with the offset. Finally the visibility collision channel response of the vehicle is changed to overlap to prevent CarSim from interacting with the vehicle mesh. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3724)

Title: Packaging maps in a single package new option target archive file
Body: #### Description We added a new command line option to collect all cooked packages in a single archive (ZIP or TAR.GZ). The option is like: `make package ARGS="--packages=Town06_Opt Town07_Opt --target-archive=MyArchive"` If the **--target-archive** is not specified each map will go to an individual archive like - Town06_Opt.tar.gz - Town07_Opt.tar.gz But with the new option specified the result will collect those two packages into a single one: - MyArchive.tar.gz We use this option to collect all maps Town06 Town07 Town10HD and all their optimized version inside the AdditionalMaps. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu Windows * **Python version(s):** - * **Unreal Engine version(s):** UE 4.24 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3737)

Title: New lidar intensity
Body: #### Description This PR improves the LiDAR raycast sensor with two major new features: - A value associated to each point cloud with an approximation of the intensity right now only based on distance - The addition of drop off lidar points to increase the realism. The percentage of points dropped can be modeleed in two different ways: - A general value method: this way also improves performance because the points are dropped before even been raycasted. - A intensity-based method: with two new parameters we can linearly drop points based in the intensity in the proportion that we are interested. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3.6 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4:24 #### Possible Drawbacks With this change the output of the sensor changes to incorporate the intensity to each cloud point. Any script that uses this sensor needs to change to accommodate to this. You can check manual_control.py or raycast_sensor_testing.py examples to see an example of this small but needed change. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3013)

Title: Fixed missing lanechange in OSM maps

Title: Improved vehicle movement components interface
Body: #### Description This PR creates a better interface for controlling vehicles using different components that may use different physics (physX CarSim etc). The class `UBaseCarlaMovementComponent` has been added and this is the base class for all other Movement Components. The virtual functions exposed in this class are used by `ACarlaWheeledVehicle` in order to control the vehicle. The class `UDefaultMovementComponent` uses the Unreal physX vehicle system (the same as before). And the class `UCarSimManagerComponent` uses CarSim to simulate the vehicle motion. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3813)

Title: Fixed bug related to RoadOptions
Body: ### Description Fixed a bug at the BehaviourAgent causing the RoadOptions to not work as intended. This was caused by having two instances of the RoadOption enumerator one at the *local_planner.py* and another one at the *local_planner_behavior.py*. Despite the fact that the latter file has one this same file also uses the *global_route_planner.py* to calculate the route of the agent which in turn uses the RoadOptions at the *local_planner.py*. This causes some unintended equality checks between these two different RoadOption enums which will always be False. This has been fixed by removing the RoadOptions enum at the *local_planner_behavior.py* and always using the one at the *local_planner.py* Fixes #3462 #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3.6 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3833)

Title: Improved benchmark script
Body: #### Description This PR improves the **performance_benchmark.py** script. The following options have been added: - Option for sync mode (**--sync** on by default) and the possibility of setting the dt as a parameter. - Added a warm-up time after spawning actors to not contaminate the performance results. - Option for no rendering mode (on by default) - Two new cases for LiDAR benchmark (100k and 1M points) - Option to benchmark only a sublist of maps (**--maps**) sensors(**--sensors**) and types of weather (**--weather**). - Parameter (**--show_scenarios**) to show all the maps sensors and types of weather possible. For using these new options you can run the following to show all the possible scenarios without running them: `python3 performance_benchmark.py --show_scenarios` Also you can show what scenarios will run with some options without actually executing them: `python3 performance_benchmark.py --sensors 2 5 --maps Town03 Town05 --weather 0 1 --show_scenarios` And then execute the performance benchmark for that scenarios: `python3 performance_benchmark.py --sensors 2 5 --maps Town03 Town05 --weather 0 1` To perform the benchmark for asynchronous mode and rendering mode: `python3 performance_benchmark.py --async --render_mode` #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3830)

Summary has been moved to end. - Updated disk space requirements from 30 GB to 165 GB. I based calculations on the 0.9.11 build I did on my system for Carla directory Unreal Engine and Visual Studio installations - Included two new prerequisites "setuptools" and ".NET framework 6.4.2" - Included warning that `make PythonAPI` can return successful even when it's not and where to check for errors - Included warning about `No module named 'carla'` error when running example scripts and how to resolve it - Added commands for installing `requirements.txt` in the `PythonAPI\examples" folder - Added command to extract `tar.gz` asset files --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3822)

Title: Initial chhrono implementation
Body: #### Description This PR brings an initial implementation of the CHRONO physics engine for vehicles (http://projectchrono.org/) to CARLA. For vehicles it adds a new function `enable_chrono_physics(max_substeps max_substep_delta_time)` which hands the physics simulation of the vehicle to CHRONO. The implementation is done in `ChronoMovementComponent.h` and `ChronoMovementComponent.cpp`. The build system has been changed to add the CHRONO library to be compiled and included in CARLA. CHRONO is added as an optional module in order to include it in your project you need to add the argument "--chrono" to the `make XXX` commands. In addition CHRONO requires RTTI enabled which requires a small modification to the Unreal Engine: in the file `Engine\Source\Programs\UnrealBuildTool\Configuration\TargetRules.cs` the line `public bool bForceEnableRTTI = false;` needs to chenge to `public bool bForceEnableRTTI = true;`. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18 Windows * **Python version(s):** 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks For Linux without the chrono module CARLA is compatible with RTTI on and off but this is not the case for Windows. If RTTI is on then the CHRONO flag should be used as well. This will change once we enable RTTI always. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3857)

Title: Bump lxml from 4 5 0 to 4 6 2 in Co Simulation Sumo
Body:
Bumps [lxml](https://github.com/lxml/lxml) from 4.5.0 to 4.6.2.
Changelog

Sourced from lxml's changelog.

4.6.2 (2020-11-26)

Bugs fixed

  • A vulnerability (CVE-2020-27783) was discovered in the HTML Cleaner by Yaniv Nizry which allowed JavaScript to pass through. The cleaner now removes more sneaky "style" content.

4.6.1 (2020-10-18)

Bugs fixed

  • A vulnerability was discovered in the HTML Cleaner by Yaniv Nizry which allowed JavaScript to pass through. The cleaner now removes more sneaky "style" content.

4.6.0 (2020-10-17)

Features added

  • GH#310: lxml.html.InputGetter supports __len__() to count the number of input fields. Patch by Aidan Woolley.

  • lxml.html.InputGetter has a new .items() method to ease processing all input fields.

  • lxml.html.InputGetter.keys() now returns the field names in document order.

  • GH-309: The API documentation is now generated using sphinx-apidoc. Patch by Chris Mayo.

Bugs fixed

  • LP#1869455: C14N 2.0 serialisation failed for unprefixed attributes when a default namespace was defined.

  • TreeBuilder.close() raised AssertionError in some error cases where it should have raised XMLSyntaxError. It now raises a combined exception to keep up backwards compatibility while switching to XMLSyntaxError as an interface.

4.5.2 (2020-07-09)

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 4cb5736 Work around Py2's lack of "re.ASCII".
  • c30106f Prepare release of 4.6.2.
  • a105ab8 Prevent combinations of <math/svg> and <style> to sneak JavaScript through th...
  • c053dc1 Add a recipe for a look-ahead generator to allow modifications during tree it...
  • b083124 lxml actually works in Py3.9.
  • 0f80590 lxml actually works in Py3.9.
  • fd8893c Add a doc note that the .find() methods are usually faster than one might exp...
  • eb6df27 Update release version on homepage.
  • 69b5c9b Automate the build artefact downloading from github and appveyor.
  • 61432a8 Prepare release of lxml 4.6.1.
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=lxml&package-manager=pip&previous-version=4.5.0&new-version=4.6.2)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. The rest of the properties about the engine and other parts of the vehicle needs to be setup by the user. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Windows Ubuntu * **Python version(s):** 3.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks to avoid unreal simulation of physics we stop Carsim simulation after the first collision of the vehicle with the world. That could change in the future when Carsim handles collisions. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3896)

Title: CARLA uses the old and new RoadRunner nomenclature
Body: #### Description RoadRunner last release has changed the way they name assets for the road. Before it was starting by **Road_** but in last version they changed to plural word **Roads_**. That broke our nomenclature for the semantic segmentation and also pedestrian navigation that are based on the name of the asset to identify different parts of a road (sidewalks crosswalks markings...). Now CARLA can use **Road_** and also **Roads_** as part of the nomenclature. All of these are valid now: - Road_Road - Roads_Road - Road_Marking - Roads_Marking - Road_Curb - Roads_Curb - Road_Gutter - Roads_Gutter - Road_Sidewalk - Roads_Sidewalk - Road_Crosswalk - Roads_Crosswalk - Road_Grass - Roads_Grass Also when a FBX amp was imported the name of the FBX was added as a prefix of the name of all assets. We were removing that name but only until the first **_** that was found. That was problematic if the name of the FBX had some **_** already because part of the FBX name was not removed properly. Now that has been fixed and the FBX name can have any **_**. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Windows * **Python version(s):** 3.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks We need to update documentation in a new PR --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3840)

Title: Chrono JSON vehicle definition
Body: #### Description This PR adds the capability to define chrono vehicles with JSON files that can be set from the python side. API changes: `actor.enable_chrono_physics(max_substeps max_substep_delta_time vehicle_json powetrain_json tire_json base_json_path)` - **max_substeps**: max number of chrono substeps - **max_substep_delta_time**: max size of substep - **vehicle_json**: relative path to vehicle json file with respect to `base_json_path` (e.g.: `hmmwv/vehicle/HMMWV_Vehicle.json`) - **powetrain_json**: relative path to powertrain json file with respect to `base_json_path` (e.g.: `hmmwv/powertrain/HMMWV_ShaftsPowertrain.json`) - **tire_json**: relative path to tire json file with respect to `base_json_path` (e.g.: `hmmwv/tire/HMMWV_Pac02Tire.json`) - **base_json_path**: path to `chrono/data/vehicle` folder (e.g.: `/home/user/carla/Build/chrono-install/share/chrono/data/vehicle/`) (final `/` character is required) Reminder: in order to activate chrono the make commands need to include the `ARGS="--chrono"`. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 Windows * **Python version(s):** 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks Invalid JSON files or paths will cause a crash in the UE4 side. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3928)

Title: Added PROJ functionality to OpenStreetMaps conversion to OpenDRIVE
Body: #### Description This PR adds the PROJ library as a dependency for CARLA to enable better projection capabilities for OpenStreetMaps conversion to OpenDRIVE (OSM2ODR). **API additions** `Osm2OdrSettings.proj_string (string)` The user can specify a PROJ.4 string to set the projection parameters. Example: `settings.proj_string = "+proj=tmerc +lat_0=0 +lon_0=0"`. `Osm2OdrSettings.center_map (bool)` Enables centering of the map. This flag disables georeference in OpenDRIVE as the origin of the map does not match latitude and longitude defined in the `proj_string`. Extra Stuff: speed up the `make PythonAPI` command and disable RTTI checks in the Boost library. #### Fixes #3009 #3686 #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 Windows * **Python version(s):** 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3901)

Title: Smoke test are now executed in a predetermined order
Body: #### Description Minor modification of the smoke test pipeline to execute all the tests in a predetermined order. This allows us to have consistency between local and build executions and to have a more robust test pipeline. The list of smoke tests is stored in the file `smoke_test_list.txt`. In extra tests are added this file need to be updated. Fixes # #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.26 #### Possible Drawbacks --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3942)

Title: Improved local planner set_global_plan function
Body: ### Description By default the local planner never stops adding waypoints to the buffer making the vehicle move aimlessly around the town forever. However this behavior is stopped whenever a global plan is set up. This PR adds a new argument that makes it optional. With an example: - Random control around town -> Set a lane change plan -> vehicle stops at the end of the lane change - Random control around town -> Set a lane change plan -> vehicle stops at the end of the lane change / keeps moving randomly (both options are available being the first one the default one) ### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3.6 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.26 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3954)

Title: Corkyw10 scenic tutorial
Body: # Scenic tutorial I have created a tutorial to explain: - The minimum requirements needed to run a Scenic script on CARLA. - How to write a simple scenario definition using one of the examples (carlaChallenge2) in the Scenic repo as an outline - How to run a Scenic script on CARLA. - Parameters used to configure Scenic simulations on CARLA. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3986)

Title: Corkyw10 import maps tutorial
Body: # Update "Add a new map" tutorial - Due to the length of the tutorial and the very distinct routes a user has to go down to prevent confusion for users I have split the tutorial into 5 parts that are on different pages: 1. Overview - this has links to each other part of the guide 2. Generate the map in RoadRunner 3. Import for source 4. Import for package 5. Deprecated methods - Due to limitations of mkdocs I can't have the different parts listed in the nav bar which is why I did the overview to act as a gateway into the tutorial. - I have added the new naming convention that will be used in the newer version of RoadRunner - I added updated pre-requisites for the package import guide - All links within the rest of the documentation have been updated to lead to the overview page - In the deprecated section the dropdowns had broken the markdown so everything has been moved out of the dropdowns and they have been removed - There has been considerable rewording and reformatting of each individual guide --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/3875)

Title: Enable the no_delay option on sockets
Body: #### Description The **no_delay** socket option was only enabled on stream sockets on the server side but not on the client side (client send the stream id at the beginning through the steam) and also not in any of the RPC sockets causing a discontinuous delay on the tick() packet. We have changed the RPCLib fork to enable this option on both client and server RPC. Now we are using the RPCLib tag v2.2.1_c5 #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu * **Python version(s):** 3.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** UE 4.26 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/4041)

There are four sections: - Scenario Runner and OpenSCENARIO - Traffic Manager - Scenic - SUMO Each section explains briefly what each feature is and what the main useful points are along with a link to the relevant docs --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/4023)

Title: Fix BuildPythonAPI cleaning and success message
Body: #### Description BuildPythonAPI.bat was broken because it was expecting `%PYTHON_LIB_PATH%` to have a trailing slash which it was missing. Fixes #2339 Behavior prior to this change: - `make clean` does not clean the intermediate files for building PythonAPI - `make PythonAPI` displays the wrong path for the build result Behavior with this change: - `make clean` properly cleans up the intermediate files located in `PythonAPI/carla/build` `PythonAPI/carla/dist` and `PythonAPI/carla/source/carla.egg-info` - `make PythonAPI` reports the correct location of the build result #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Windows 10 x64 * **Python version(s):** ... 3.6 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** ... 4.22.3 #### Possible Drawbacks Now that `make clean` actually attempts to clean up the intermediate build artifacts in case they are held by some other process `make clean` may fail to clean up some of the directories. This is bog standard for Windows so as long as people are paying attention to the output of `make clean` all should be well. Existing issue: code does not check for existing installs so we can still end up with multiple egg files in `dist` if we do not `make clean` --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/2348)

Title: Created new tests for LIDAR and BBs
Body: #### Description Added two tests (done via python scripts). - One of the tests (check_bb_tags.py and load_bb_database.py) is for making sure that the bounding boxes present in the world have not been modified in any way. Run the "load_bb_database.py" script (with Carla open) for setting up the SQLite database (will simply generate a SQLite db file with the bounding boxes of the world) and secondly run the "check_bb_tags.py" script in order to know if any of the bb have been modified. This is useful when you want to make sure that the bbs have not been moved during your simulation. - The second test is for making sure that the LIDAR can detect the bounding boxes of all the different cars correctly. This test however can only be run on "Map_03". It will begin spawning multiple cars and throw an error through console if any of them is not correct. Fixes # #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Window * **Python version(s):** 3.7.9 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.24 #### Possible Drawbacks --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/4079)

Title: Bump lxml from 4 5 0 to 4 6 3 in Co Simulation Sumo
Body:
Bumps [lxml](https://github.com/lxml/lxml) from 4.5.0 to 4.6.3.
Changelog

Sourced from lxml's changelog.

4.6.3 (2021-03-21)

Bugs fixed

  • A vulnerability (CVE-2021-28957) was discovered in the HTML Cleaner by Kevin Chung which allowed JavaScript to pass through. The cleaner now removes the HTML5 formaction attribute.

4.6.2 (2020-11-26)

Bugs fixed

  • A vulnerability (CVE-2020-27783) was discovered in the HTML Cleaner by Yaniv Nizry which allowed JavaScript to pass through. The cleaner now removes more sneaky "style" content.

4.6.1 (2020-10-18)

Bugs fixed

  • A vulnerability was discovered in the HTML Cleaner by Yaniv Nizry which allowed JavaScript to pass through. The cleaner now removes more sneaky "style" content.

4.6.0 (2020-10-17)

Features added

  • GH#310: lxml.html.InputGetter supports __len__() to count the number of input fields. Patch by Aidan Woolley.

  • lxml.html.InputGetter has a new .items() method to ease processing all input fields.

  • lxml.html.InputGetter.keys() now returns the field names in document order.

  • GH-309: The API documentation is now generated using sphinx-apidoc. Patch by Chris Mayo.

Bugs fixed

... (truncated)

Commits
  • a5f9cb5 Prepare release of lxml 4.6.3.
  • 2d01a1b Add HTML-5 "formaction" attribute to "defs.link_attrs" (GH-316)
  • e986a9c Fix reference in docs.
  • 4cb5736 Work around Py2's lack of "re.ASCII".
  • c30106f Prepare release of 4.6.2.
  • a105ab8 Prevent combinations of <math/svg> and <style> to sneak JavaScript through th...
  • c053dc1 Add a recipe for a look-ahead generator to allow modifications during tree it...
  • b083124 lxml actually works in Py3.9.
  • 0f80590 lxml actually works in Py3.9.
  • fd8893c Add a doc note that the .find() methods are usually faster than one might exp...
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Title: New import process to cook large maps divided in tiles
Body: #### Description Now we can import large maps in tiles resulting in a individual .umap per tile. As before if you don't specify a .json file when importing one is created automatically. A sample one is like this: > { > "maps": [ > { > "name": "testmap" > "xodr": "./testmap.xodr" > "use_carla_materials": true > "tiles": [ > "./testmap_Tile_0_0.fbx" > "./testmap_Tile_0_1.fbx" > "./testmap_Tile_1_0.fbx" > "./testmap_Tile_1_1.fbx" > ] > } > ] > "props": [] > } For the automatic generation of .json to work we need to be sure that the tile have this nomenclature ..._Tile_i_j... the _i_ and _j_ are the index of the tile starting at (0 0). The import process will end as soon as one tile is not found. When a map is in tiles then the **tiles** keyword are in use with the list of all the tiles in .fbx form. If the map is in single mode then we use the **source** keyword with the single .fbx. for the map. The .umap tiles are intended to be used as map containers so there is no sky light on those maps or any other information. Just meshes. Other than the map each tile will have its own .bin file for the pedestrian navigation. The .xodr is a single one that is for the whole map like in single maps. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu / Windows * **Python version(s):** 3.7 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** UE 4.26 #### Possible Drawbacks We need more code to manage the large map tiles so this PR is only for the cooking process. --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/4094)

Title: Large Maps
Body: #### Description This PR adds the first iteration of the large map feature. It goes with a related content branch named `doterop/large_map` as it requires the LargeMap umap template to work. This feature enables loading maps of virtually infinite size. The large map assumes a map divided in small portions (tiles) of a maximum side size of 2km. The tiles need to be square. The LargeMap streams the tiles in and out of the server limiting the elements that participate in the simulation at any given time. Only the regions around the hero/ego vehicle is loaded at any given time including static geometry and dynamic actors. This introduces the concept of `dormant actors` which are actors that are not simulating physics or being rendered. When the hero/ego vehicle moves tiles and actors that become too far away are converted to dormant and woken up once the distance is reduced. Dormant actors are present as normal actors in the client API and receive commands but are processed once they wake up. The `actor.is_dormant` flag has been added to the python API to allow the client know when an actor is dormant or not. In the Unreal side dormant AActor are destroyed and recreated on demand while the registry of actors keeps track of them. In the LargeMap there is an actor called LargeMapManager that handles the tile information: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35765780/118302150-2a4a7d00-b4e4-11eb-9249-43282bc59a5d.png) It is necessary to edit the following fields: `Large Map Tile Path`: the path to the folder with the tiles. `Large Map Name`: the name of the map that needs to match the OpenDRIVE. `Tile 0Offset`: The position of the (0 0) tile. `Tile Side`: the dimensions of the tile in cm. #### Where has this been tested? * **Platform(s):** Ubuntu 18.04 * **Python version(s):** 3 * **Unreal Engine version(s):** 4.26 --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/carla-simulator/carla/4207)
